title: The Miseducation of Freddie Gibbs / Midwestgangstaboxframecadillacmuzik
label: self-released
description: With an armful of new Just Blaze and Polow da Don beats, this Gary, Ind., MC and ex-Interscope signee is breathing fresh air into hardscrabble mixtape rap.

title: Life of Leisure EP
label: Mexican Summer
description: Highly promising young songwriter continues to show why he's one of chillwave's rising stars.

title: Tribute To
label: ATO
description: My Morning Jacket's Jim James pays tribute to the late George Harrison on this mostly solo acoustic journey through a half-dozen of the quiet Beatle's songs.

title: Hey Friend, What You Doing?
label: De Stijl
description: We might be getting close to some kind of lo-fi tipping point here, folks.

title: The Broad Street Bully
label: Siccness
description: After the demise of Roc-A-Fella, Beanie unearths a collection of "lost" tracks for a free mixtape that doubles as his best work since The B.Coming.

title: Ashes Grammar
label: Mis Ojos Discos
description: Philly septet continues its winning streak on this sprawling and ambitious affair, masterfully puzzled together from a wide range of parts.

title: The Resistance
label: Warner Bros.
description: Muse are back, with an LP of all-caps, no half-stepping ART-ROCK that closes with a three-part epic so shameless about its size it's billed as a "Symphony."

title: The Velvet Underground & Nico
label: self-released
description: Making great use of his home studio and L.A. friends, Beck kicks off his off-the-cuff, unrehearsed covers of full LPs by taking on VU's debut.

title: Orange You Glad
label: Olde English Spelling Bee
description: Chillwave fixture releases an album of airy electronics, late-1960s psychedelia, and slow-burn rhythms.

title: Out Into the Snow
label: Team Love
description: Like a modern-day Leonard Cohen, Simon Joyner's poetic lyrics and beaten-down vocals gesture as much to characters or melodies as they do articulate them.

title: The Almighty Defenders
label: Vice
description: Black Lips, King Khan, and Mark Sultan spent a week crafting this record in Berlin. And it sounds like it.

title: Crazy Rhythms / The Good Earth
label: Domino
description: Three-chord punk boiled down to two-chord devotionals, these two amazing Feelies records are back, and both are worth a lot of your time.

title: The Blueprint 3
label: Atlantic
description: More Blueprint 2 than Blueprint, Jay-Z's latest is actually closer to Kingdom Come than either of those others. Unfortunately.

title: Heartbeat Radio
label: Rounder
description: Again paying close attention to arrangements and general songcraft, the Norwegian transplant reinforces his pleasant earnestness.

title: Mister Pop
label: Merge
description: The Kiwi Pop giants and lo-fi all-stars return with, incredibly, only the fifth LP in their storied career.

title: Masters of the Burial
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Stars and Broken Social Scene singer steps out for her second woodsy solo album.

title: Break Up
label: Rhino
description: Continuing her high-wire act of a musical career, ScarJo follows her trip into the Tom Waits songbook with an album inspired by 1960s Gainsbourg/Bardot duets.

title: The Stone Roses
label: Sony
description: A badly needed remaster of this landmark LP sounds even fresher than it did 20 years ago-- and thanks to Sony there are now loads of expensive ways to hear it.

title: Past Masters
label: EMI
description: For the first time, the singles/EPs/leftovers compilations Past Masters are combined and sold in one glorious package.

title: Let It Be
label: EMI
description: After the discord of The Beatles, the group sought to get back to basics with a rock LP and a film about its creation. This was the eventual result.

title: Abbey Road
label: EMI
description: The perfect ending to a recording career, this LP shows a band still in its prime, capable of songwriting and recording feats others could only envy.

title: Yellow Submarine
label: EMI
description: The only minor album in the Beatles' catalogue is this soundtrack to a feature-length cartoon, a project with which the Beatles had little involvement.

title: The Beatles
label: EMI
description: Indulgent, sprawling, overflowing with ideas and excess, the White Album became not only a monument to unbridled creativity but a rock archetype.

title: Rock Band
label: Electronic Arts
description: Harmonix updates the hugely popular video game for the Beatles-- 45 songs from across their career are represented-- and gives it a markedly different vibe.

title: Magical Mystery Tour
label: EMI
description: The only American release to become part of the Beatles' canon, Magical Mystery Tour combines a soundtrack EP and some brilliant singles.

title: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
label: EMI
description: Though it has perhaps slipped in estimation since its initial issue, the 1967 release that defined the LP format still packs surprises.

title: Revolver
label: EMI
description: As they devoted more time to the studio, the Beatles' individual voices and confidence continued to grow, resulting in the sonic landmark Revolver.

title: Rubber Soul
label: EMI
description: The Beatles' first undisputed masterpiece is their quietest and most folky record, reflecting the influences of contemporaries like Dylan and the Byrds.

title: Help!
label: EMI
description: The Help! soundtrack album is as haphazard as Beatles For Sale, but it lacks that record's glowering intensity; it's a great but confusing record.

title: Beatles For Sale
label: EMI
description: The angriest, most aggressive record in the Beatles catalogue, For Sale finds them reaching back to their Hamburg club days in both attitude and sound.

title: A Hard Day's Night
label: EMI
description: A Hard Day's Night is from an era when pop and showbiz were inseparable-- and if it doesn't transcend that time, it does represent its definitive peak.

title: With the Beatles
label: EMI
description: Released just before eventual U.S. gamechanger "I Want to Hold Your Hand", this quickie sequel doesn't match its predecessor but doesn't cheat fans either.

title: Please Please Me
label: EMI
description: A raw, high-energy run-through of their early live set, the Beatles' debut is also the sound of rock'n'roll finding a suddenly large, new audience.

title: Stereo Box / In Mono
label: EMI
description: Stereo Box / In Mono

title: The Entrance Band
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Guy Blakeslee recruits a rhythm section à la the Jimi Hendrix Experience and adds "Band" to the name of his Entrance project.

title: The Sub Pop Years
description: Galaxie 500's rhythm section went on to make some subtly powerful albums, and this comp draws from their output on Sub Pop between 1995 and 2002.

title: No More Stories Are Told Today...
label: Columbia
description: Danish prog-pop maestros, here sporting an absurdly long album title, consolidate everything that's made them interesting to date.

title: Sidetracked
label: Renaissance
description: Hercules and Love Affair's first commercial mix affords Andy Butler the opportunity to step outside the confines of his group and straight-up DJ.

title: East of Eden
label: Rough Trade
description: The former Concretes singer travels to Pakistan to record her second TbT album. Studio's Dan Lissvik produces; Panda Bear guests.

title: After Robots
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Pushing against a mountain of hype, BLK JKS' debut LP is hugely ambitious, with a bigness of sound that's hard to approximate and control.

title: Intuit
label: Barsuk
description: Brent Knopf of Menomena and a huge cast of his friends get together to create a record full of meticulous attention to sonic and compositional details.

title: Temporary Pleasure
label: Wichita
description: A grab bag of styles, SMD's latest features Hot Chip's Alexis Taylor, SFA's Gruff Rhys, Jamie Lidell, Beth Ditto, and Yeasayer's Chris Keating.

title: Signal Morning
label: Cloud
description: Olivia Tremor Control ringleader Will Cullen Hart and his Circulatory System return after a lengthy absence with their highly anticipated sophomore album.

title: Diary / LP2
label: Sub Pop
description: A template for both emo and modern rock, Sunny Day's original lineup has its two records reissued, with bonus cuts, and they deserve reassessment.

title: Fervency
label: Moodgadget
description: Following in the shadow of William Basinski and Stars of the Lid, this NYC drone artist works in self-effacing quietude, crafting patient, conceptual works.

title: Welcome Joy
label: Matador
description: Pretty Girls Make Graves' Derek Fudesco returns to lead his fellow Pac NWesterners on their second LP of ultracasual back-porch folk music.

title: As Good as Gone
label: Kranky
description: After dabbling in electronic ambience, heavy-beat IDM, and fractured funk, this Kranky band has hit upon a winning combination of sounds.

title: Haih or Amortecedor
label: Anti-
description: Tropicália legends unite for their first studio album in 35 years, which includes songwriting contributions from Jorge Ben and Tom Zé.

title: Everything Goes Wrong
label: In the Red
description: Facing the prospect of following a hyped debut and the backlash against shitgaze in general, Vivian Girls issue their second album.

title: Songs for the New Industrial State
label: Light in the Attic
description: A strange record from the early 1970s is reissued, and it combines adult-aimed light music and California pop-psych with anti-consumerist social commentary.

title: Alice and Friends
label: Goner
description: No, they're not named after the Pavement tune; though they are noisy and lo-fi, Box Elders are more enamored of 1960s garage rock touchstones.

title: Red
label: Young Aspiring Professionals
description: Norwegian dance-rockers return with a collection of songs boiled down to more pop-friendly lengths and their goofy humor still intact.

title: In Prism
label: Merge
description: Math-rock band returns after 11 years with not just a good reunion album, but also the most immediately satisfying record in their entire catalogue.

title: Popular Songs
label: Matador
description: The indie rock perennials return with yet another accomplished album, again reminding us why they're among the most consistently rewarding bands of our time.

title: One Foot Ahead of the Other
label: Ramp
description: Dubstep star follows his excellent rave-tinged LP Where Were U in 92? with an EP that veers closer to the kaleidoscopic melodies of his singles.

title: Disconnected
label: Hydra Head
description: Justin Broadrick of Jesu (among others) and Aaron Turner of Isis team up for a record that the former says taps into his aggressive side.

title: Get Color
label: Lovepump United
description: HEALTH follow their apocalyptic debut, arguably better remix album, and thrashing, industrial-disco single "Die Slow" with LP No. 2.

title: The Fine Print (A Collection Of Oddities and Rarities 2003-2008)
label: New West
description: The Southern rock band culls through its recent archives and compiles a dozen rarities on this odds'n'sods collection.

title: Two Dancers
label: Domino
description: UK quartet follows 2008's fidgety, impulsive baroque-rock debut, Limbo, Panto, with an album that refashions them as a steely art-funk outfit.

title: Quest For Fire
label: Tee Pee
description: Finally available in the U.S., via Tee Pee, this Toronto metal band offers distended riffs, patient drumming, and subtle textures.

title: A Slave's Commitment
label: Traum Schallplatten
description: One of dance's hip young gunslingers, 21-year-old, Amsterdam-based Pascal Terstappen, issues his debut LP on the venerable Traum label.

title: City Limits Volume 1
label: Deep Medi
description: London-based dubstep producer blends jazzy sophistication with the archetypal shuddering bass wobbles on this excellent collection.

title: 1 Hits Explosion
label: Yep Roc
description: This best-of shaves away some of the small gestures that have made the Apples a favorite, but retains their power as a modern pop band.

title: xx
label: Young Turks
description: Young UK band influenced by modern R&B lands on the scene with a terrific debut, filled with seductive songs set to spare but effective arrangements.

title: Anti-Magic
label: Upset the Rhythm
description: No Age-associated drum'n'vocal band tests listener endurance on its latest collection of loud, spastic, and often complicated music.

title: L'Autopsie Phénoménale de Dieu
label: Miasmah
description: The latest majestically bleak ambient classical release from Norwegian label Miasmah Records, this LP helps make the world a slightly darker, lonelier place.

title: To Swift Mars
label: Polyvinyl
description: Aloha member comes across as a thoughtful, subtly clever musician with an ear for low-key melodies and a mind for cerebral indie rock poetry.

title: My Guilty Pleasure
label: Paper Bag
description: Mysterious Italo-disco singer returns with the follow-up to the exquisite isolation of her debut, Disco Romance.

title: Hail to the Thief: Special Collectors Edition
label: Capitol
description: After four LPs that pushed the boundaries of what's expected from a rock band, Radiohead internalized leftfield electronics yet embraced straightforward rock.

title: Wave If You're Really There
label: Neapolitan
description: Like Devo or Hot Chip before them, this Liverpool band aims for nerdy electro-pop and tidy funk on its debut LP.

title: Tummaa
label: Leaf
description: Sasu Ripatti returns under his clicks'n'cuts-gone-ambient name for a new album of loops, thwacks, and other micro-sounds.

title: Love Comes Close
label: Heartworm
description: Moody synth-poppers from Philly, whose contributors include members of Xiu Xiu and Prurient, make an impressive full-length debut.

title: Walking on a Wire: Richard Thompson (1968-2009)
label: Shout! Factory
description: 4xCD retrospective of cult-favorite British singer/guitarist's work is the closest thing to the career-spanning greatest-hits album he deserves.

title: Amnesiac: Special Collectors Edition
label: Capitol
description: Met with confusion back in 2001, just nine months after the landmark Kid A, Amnesiac can take its rightful place among Radiohead's classics.

title: Posthumous Success
label: Fat Cat
description: The North Dakota troubadour draws from Woody Guthrie's folk wanderlust, Cole Porter's cosmopolitanism, and Jeff Buckley's arty otherworldliness.

title: Infidel
label: Heavy Artillery
description: Thrash metal veterans return during their sound's revival with a record that feels both retro and contemporary.

title: Awe Owe
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Guillermo Scott Herren collaborator's project is similarly enamored of Latin American psych-folk, scratchy beats, and warm, homemade production.

title: Cartography
label: ECM
description: The adventurous trumpet player, best known for his work with Supersilent and his solo records on Rune Grammofon, makes a terrific debut for ECM.

title: Kid A: Special Collectors Edition
label: Capitol
description: Capitol follows its excavation of Radiohead's 1990s work with new version of the band's first three 2000s LPs, including the landmark Kid A.

title: Conditions
label: Liberation
description: Australian band with radio-friendly ambitions follows its "Sweet Disposition" single with a record that shoots for the heights of the Arctic Monkeys or U2.

title: If You Know What's Good for Ya!!
label: DFA
description: DFA partner Rong Music collects this electro-pop artist's post-2005 singles and pairs them with fresh material.

title: Slaughterhouse
label: E1
description: Hip-hop supergroup (Crooked I, Joell Ortiz, Royce Da 5'9", and Joe Budden) is united by little more than shared failures and a love of bareknuckle rhyming.

title: Landscapes
label: Olde English Spelling Bee
description: Latest album from the one-man psychedelic pop project of Matthew Mondanile, guitarist for North Jersey up-and-comers Real Estate.

title: Humbug
label: Domino
description: The Arctics expand their sound with the help of producer Josh Homme (QOTSA) on this, their relatively relaxed, confident third album.

title: The Phenomenal Handclap Band
label: Friendly Fire
description: New York-area band, joined by guests from TV on the Radio and the Dap-Kings among others, concoct slightly spacy live-band psych-disco.

title: Hard Knox or, "Are You Sure Hank Jr. Done It This Way?" / Born Bad
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: James Jackson Toth (Wooden Wand) continues to be both prolific and promising, with a recent collection of old home demos and a new LP for Ecstatic Peace.

title: Snow Blindness Is Crystal Antz
label: Flemish Eye
description: Indie rock Renaissance man Chad VanGaalen offers a collection of 19 electronics-heavy instrumentals that allow him to stretch out and experiment.

title: Ze 30: Ze Records Story 1979-2009
label: Strut
description: The adventurous New York label that helped to define the sound of early-1980s left-field dance music celebrates its 30th with a comp.

title: Wind's Poem
label: P.W. Elverum & Sun
description: Phil Elverum returns with the latest piece in the epic, ongoing existential puzzle he's been constructing for nearly 15 years.

title: Season Dreaming
label: Kanine
description: This Florida psych-pop duo's debut owes just about everything to Animal Collective.

title: Lungs
label: Island
description: Unlike fellow quirky UK songstresses La Roux and Little Boots, Florence Welch moves away from the Lily/Amy template by building her career from the bottom up.

title: We Gave It All Away, Now We Are Taking It Back
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Maximalist dance duo collect its remixes on a gargantuan 2xCD remix compilation that reveals the group's eclectic nature and considerable talents.

title: I Love You
label: Downtown
description: Lady Gaga minus the tunes, ambition, or sense of purpose.

title: Total 10
label: Kompakt
description: The seminal label celebrates its 10th year with a new Total comp, featuring the Field, Reinhard Voigt, Ada, Gui Boratto, DJ Koze, and Justus Köhncke.

title: Arrivals
label: Gizeh
description: Leeds duo moves away from its IDM-bolstered post-rock to something more compelling, like Burial for English-lit majors.

title: Silk Flowers
label: Post Present Medium
description: This charismatic Brooklyn trio sounds less like a Xerox of classic artists Suicide, Cabaret Voltaire, or PiL and more like one of their minor contemporaries.

title: Fear of Song
label: La Mano
description: The former Low bassist issues a new record financed in part by his eBay sales of his ex-band's album art.

title: Memoirs at the End of the World
label: Unfiltered
description: After a delightful debut and a covers album, the Postmarks ramp up their sound on this collection of Mancini/Morricone/John Barry-literate indie pop.

title: Watch Me Fall
label: Matador
description: After two singles comps, the Memphis punk makes his Matador studio LP debut and continues to embrace infectious Kiwi pop as well as 60s garage rock.

title: Destination Tokyo
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: On this Smalltown Supersound EP, Tokyo's Nisennenmondai move past post-punk talking points and pay more attention to their songs.

title: Clubroot
label: Lo Dubs
description: The next big dubstep album comes not from the big-name 12" producers around, but this veteran producer with roots in drum'n'bass.

title: Creaturesque
label: Secretly Canadian
description: After a promising start, TMTS are still struggling to shake a few influences while picking up a few familiar moves from others.

title: Live at the Folklore Center, NYC - March 6th, 1967
label: Tompkins Square
description: Recorded when he was just 20, this CD finds the L.A. singer invading the NYC folk scene and exploring jazz, raga, psychedelia, rock, and even schmaltz.

title: Solo Electric Bass 1
label: Warp
description: Tom Jenkinson returns to his "classic" sound, albeit with a twist-- this is a live, solo performance recorded in Paris.

title: Pop Psychology
label: Urban Myth
description: Canadian singer-songwriter offers a self-deprecating look at navigating the crumbling music industry.

title: My Old, Familiar Friend
label: ATO
description: The other Raconteurs singer-songwriter returns with his first solo album in the spotlight enjoyed as an occassional musical partner of Jack White.

title: Luminous Night
label: Drag City
description: Latest from the prolific and influential avant-folk artist is something of a summary record, demonstrating most of the range he's shown over the years.

title: King of Jeans
label: Sub Pop
description: Latest from Pennsylvania scuzz-punk revivalists consolidates their strengths, harnessing their fire-extinguisher splatter into shake-appealing rock action.

title: Bay of Pigs EP
label: Merge
description: The rumors were true: Dan Bejar's new two-song EP is boosted by a 13-minute-long slab of ambient disco, complete with footnote-worthy lyrics.

title: The Future's Looking Grim
label: Jib Door
description: Latest from Chicago MC/producer team finds them coming closer to capturing the charm of their live show.

title: Physical Changes
label: Radium
description: Despite spending time with Pele, Collections of Colonies of Bees, and Volcano Choir, uncompromising percussionist Jon Mueller is arguably best on his own.

title: Dark Rift
label: Lovepump United
description: On his proper full-length debut, Denver's Travis Egedy combines samples and an ear for the best parts of dance pop from an earlier era.

title: The Smith Westerns
label: HoZac
description: Rummaging through glam, teen-pop, and garage-punk, this Chicago band exudes an earnestness almost as pure as its recording levels are deafening.

title: Woodstock 40 Years On: Back to Yasgur's Farm
label: Rhino
description: Cultural institution is honored with a 6xCD box from Rhino. Jimi Hendrix, the Who, Sly and the Family Stone, Jefferson Airplane, and CSN appear.

title: Psychic Maps
label: Relapse
description: Inscrutable metal band, led by guitarist Kevin Hufnagel, releases its latest Relapse record.

title: My Favorite Things, Vol. 2
label: Mule
description: Japan-based Mule Electronic celebrates its fifth anniversary with a set featuring exclusive tracks from Isolée, Minilogue, Move D, Lawrence, and DJ Koze.

title: Speech Therapy
label: Big Dada
description: Rising UK hip-hop artist earned a Mercury Prize nomination for this fine, fresh, serious (yet never dour) album.

title: Alien in a Garbage Dump
label: Paw Tracks
description: Black Dice leader compiles a pair of vinyl-only EPs onto CD, and the whole thing sounds like a psychedelic version of childhood.

title: Elephant Jokes
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: Prolific Guided by Voices leader follows his turgid The Crawling Distance with a deliberate, punchy front-to-back rock record.

title: City Center
label: Type
description: Saturday Looks Good to Me's Fred Thomas creates a record that ranges between early Paw Tracks' folk abstractions and the recent outpouring of lo-fi dream beat.

title: Braveface
label: Transgressive
description: Fractured pop from a flattop-sporting Brit doesn't reach its experimental aspirations.

title: New Universe
label: K
description: Olympia, Wash., project's second full-length is an improvement, as gauzy sonics that are not so much lo-fi as lo-res are used in service of stronger songs.

title: Last Night the Moon Came Dropping Its Clothes in the Street
label: ECM
description: This acknowledged inheritor of Miles Davis and Teo Macero's experiments in electric jazz and studio-aided collage composition creates a stunning new LP.

title: See Mystery Lights
label: DFA
description: __NOTE: Record and track reviews return next week. In the meantime, t____his space highlights our most recent Best New Music selections. Enjoy!__

title: Apple's Acre
label: Dead Oceans
description: After several years of wandering, harmony-happy psych-rockers Nurses put down roots in Portland and made an album that sounds homemade in the best way.

title: Kabukimono
label: Manimal Vinyl
description: On the heels of their 2008 Basta EP comes another short record from the L.A.-based global fusion duo, which includes remixes and new songs.

title: It Feels So Good When I Stop
label: Ashmont
description: Following a novella inspired by the Smiths, the singer-songwriter pens his first novel-- and releases an accompanying soundtrack.

title: Infinite Light
label: Jagjaguwar
description: The Black Mountain members' latest LP starts with basic pop templates and expands on them with inventive, genre-exploding arrangements.

title: Hospice
label: Frenchkiss
description: Brooklyn band offers a skyscraping blend of the ambient and the anthemic, a record that swings for the bleachers at a time when it's fashionable to bunt.

title: Kesämaan Lapset
label: Fonal
description: Fonal boss Sami Sänpäkkilä follows his quietly wonderful 2xCD Sateenkaarisuudelma with another sprawling electronic soundworld.

title: Music For Falling From Trees
label: Western Vinyl
description: Having worked with Efterklang, Library Tapes, and others, in addition to recording his own music, the young composer turns his attention to a dance score.

title: Love and Curses
label: In the Red
description: Memphis garage-rock fixture Greg Cartwright continues to unearth intriguing corners of 1950s and 60s rock and pop.

title: The Ruminant Band
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop veteran Eric Johnson makes AM Gold fresh again by filtering his own spirit through a cast of characters.

title: No One's First and You're Next
label: Epic
description: Collecting previously released songs from the late 00s, this comp is in the spirit of Building Nothing... and ...Parlour Tricks.

title: History of the Units
label: Community Library
description: Thirty years after the fact, this "lost" San Francisco band sounds like it's imitating Devo; in its day, the group was wholly original and often compelling.

title: Troubled, Shaken Etc.
label: Social Registry
description: Incorporating free jazz, krautrock, and swirling instrumental passages, the UK group's latest full-length is more ambitious than its predecessor.

title: The Strange Boys and Girls Club
label: In the Red
description: In the Red garage-rock band sounds more like juvenile-delinquent Nuggets types than today's marketable hipster revivalists.

title: Hymn to the Immortal Wind
label: Temporary Residence
description: Veteran Japanese instrumental quartet makes big, emotional hard/post-rock that aims to make a listener feel.

title: Julian Plenti Is... Skyscraper
label: Matador
description: Interpol's Paul Banks resurrects his Eurotrash-y recording alias and puts out a solo album not-so-hot on the heels of his band's first truly not-good record.

title: Paint the Fence Invisible
label: Black and Greene
description: Like their occasional tourmates Dr. Dog, this duo crafts solid power pop largely devoid of any influence from the past three decades.

title: Jamz n Jemz
label: self-released
description: New York's Javelin are hardcore cratediggers in the vein of artists like Quiet Village but their sensibility is far more playful and informed by trash culture.

title: Clean Hands Go Foul
label: Hydra Head
description: Presumably now done forever, Khanate go out kicking and screaming as always, making music that-- even in the realm of extreme music-- is dark and distorted.

title: Hard Islands
label: Border Community
description: After the psych-IDM success of 2006's Drowning in a Sea of Love, the Border Community star scales back his sound and shifts his primary focus to rhythm.

title: Midlife: A Beginner's Guide to Blur
label: EMI
description: A new comp from a band whose stature has only grown in its absence finds Blur reshaping their identity and favoring the artier end of their catalog.

title: Arecibo Message
label: Planet µ
description: Nominally dubstep, this LP is the work of a man who's studied the past 20 years of electronic music with a historian's eye for exacting detail.

title: Tuota Tuota
label: Fonal
description: Finland's consistently intriguing and rewarding Fonal label offers another mix of Northern European folk and free improv.

title: Saskamodie
label: Crammed Discs
description: Frequent collaborator with Feist and Jamie Lidell ditches his electro-funk in favor of songs in the spirit of 60s lounge jazz and easy-listening soul.

title: My World
label: Truth & Soul
description: Real-deal old-school funk and soul singer makes a tremendous comeback on a record that mixes elements of the Stax, Muscle Shoals, and Philly soul sounds.

title: The Magic Couple
label: Wrasse
description: Malian duo have its late-1990s, early 2000s work for A&M collected and compiled for a second time, but first since becoming global superstars.

title: El Radio
label: Absolutely Kosher
description: With simple progressions and heart-on-sleeve lyrics, this singer-songwriter's innocence and earnestness makes for roomy, breezy kitchen-sink indie.

title: Part I: John Shade, Your Fortune's Made
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: The mysterious Fol Chen play click-push electro-acoustic pop that attempts to sound like Junior Boys in places, Talking Heads in others.

title: Rewild
label: V2
description: These MGMT buddies have been the focus of a comparable amount of early hype, and Rewild is an uneven but entertaining mix of pop-psych and glam rock.

title: Lovetune for Vacuum
label: PIAS
description: Young Austrian singer Anja Plaschg debuts with a darkly intriguing album that combines references as disparate as Regina Spektor and Autechre.

title: Ayrton Senna EP
label: Fool House
description: Sunny electronic euphoria has been one of the late-decade underground's richest musical nodes, and this Barcelona electro-pop put a beautiful spin on the sound.

title: Winter Hill
label: Unknown
description: Led by singer/sculptor Liz McGrath, this L.A. band blends country, punk, rockabilly, showtunes, and cabaret into a surprisingly sturdy sound.

title: He Was King
label: Nettwerk
description: Still messing with electro-pop when his strengths so obviously lie in tracky house, Felix da Housecat returns with his first LP in five years.

title: Seya
label: Nonesuch
description: Elder stateswoman of Malian music is joined by 47 collaborators who provide a seamless mix of old and new sounds for her confident vocals and activist lyrics.

title: Blue Roses
label: XL
description: The self-titled debut from 21-year-old British songwriter Laura Groves, under the name Blue Roses, thrives on the romance of youth and the unknown.

title: L.A. EP 3 X 3
label: Warp
description: Third EP reimagining Los Angeles tracks is the most intriguing, a seven-track suite featuring two new songs and a handful of bold recontextualizations.

title: Local Flavor
label: Siltbreeze
description: Though they are on the garage-rock-leaning Siltbreeze imprint, Blues Control opt for a more expansive blend of instrumental, machine-tinged psychedelic rock.

title: The Satanic Satanist
label: Equal Vision
description: After four albums and four EPs of ambitious yet friendly, pristine and proggish indie pop since 2006, this oddly named band steps into the spotlight.

title: Confiote de Bits: A Remix Collection
label: BBE
description: This 2xCD collection of the French house musician's remixes from the past decade couldn't have come at a better time.

title: White Ink, Black Ink
label: Rebel Group
description: After more than a decade, Wheat continue to explore the frayed edges of pop songcraft.

title: Gather, Form & Fly
label: Hometapes
description: Former bandmates of Bon Iver continue to impress on this, their second album of ingeniously ramshackle folk rock.

title: Eugene McGuinness
label: Domino
description: After a debut of irresistible juvenilia, the London musician graduates to more mature themes: sex, love, work, God.

title: Of the Cathmawr Yards
label: Hidden Agenda
description: Members of Freakwater and the Zincs team for a record that builds on the Windy City's legacy of alt-country, skewed folk, and jazz hybridization.

title: Radio Wars
label: Independiente
description: Just off a high-profile tour with Coldplay and Snow Patrol, this London-via-Sydney band releases its second album and first in three years.

title: The Best B Sides Ever
description: The UK indie pop duo releases an extras compilation, originally bundled with Rough Trade Shop pre-orders for The Law of the Playground.

title: Person to Person
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Another in a line of 2009 beachcombers, L.A.'s Foreign Born offer an LP that feels like a conversation with the Pacific Coast and sounds like endless summer.

title: Sacred Psalms
label: Fat Cat
description: Three years after its debut, and a year after its second album and EP, the young and wooly noise-folk outfit returns.

title: Lessons in the Woods or a City
label: Hardly Art
description: Seattle art-punk trio, true to its own, locates interesting turns in the mechanical, the proletariat, and the cruelly ironic.

title: Georgiavania
label: Lex
description: MC Khujo Goodie of Goodie Mob and producer Jneiro Jarel team up on a startlingly original album that's unafraid to be strange but still bumps.

title: Mutually Arising
label: Kranky
description: Versatile producer here turns his attention to static long-form drone, crafting two pieces of more than 20 minutes each.

title: I'm Going Away
label: Thrill Jockey
description: The often inscrutable Friedberger siblings make a welcome comeback on this, their most accessible record in years.

title: To Win or to Lose
label: K
description: Rootsy Alabama band with a punk streak returns with another strong album packed with varied instrumentation and evocative imagery.

title: Dabke 2020: Folk and Pop Sounds of Syria
label: Sublime Frequencies
description: Drawing from Kurdish and Turkic music, Iraqi choubi, and the dabke, Souleyman makes a modernized blend of old musics that collide in the modern Middle East.

title: Rites
label: Drag City
description: Drag City debut is a wonderful stoner rock record, but so much more, finding inspiration in everything from soul and country to radio pop and classic rock.

title: The Knot
label: Merge
description: After its surprising, quietly effective debut, If Children, Merge band returns with a new set of gorgeous songs.

title: Josephine
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Billed as a comparatively sparse counterpoint to Magnolia's recent classic-rock material, Josephine is the first Jason Molina album in three years.

title: Blood Oath
label: Nuclear Blast
description: With the most powerful yet clear production of Suffocation's career, Blood Oath best crystallizes their death metal formula.

title: Change Remains
label: Barsuk
description: After three LPs of solidly composed, occasionally brilliant indie songs in chamber-pop drag, Starlight Mints have stretched out and changed their formula.

title: Always Wrong
label: Hospital
description: Michigan noise trio keeps plugging along, crafting massive textures, severe sonics, and daunting tension from all kinds of sources.

title: Totems Flare
label: Warp
description: The imaginative IDM producer behind 2006's awesome Body Riddle adds his own voice to the mix and increases the clatter, to mixed results.

title: Riceboy Sleeps
label: XL
description: Sigur Rós' Jonsi Birgisson unveils a new project, an all-acoustic duo created with Alex Somers.

title: Until the Earth Begins to Part
label: 4AD
description: Very, very serious Scottish band believes hard in the redemptive power of a bunch of people playing instruments at the same time.

title: The Great Cessation
label: Profound Lore
description: With their signature 10-ton riffs and glacial tempos, few bands do what YOB do-- marry Black Sabbath's heavy and psychedelic sides.

title: Chemical Warfare
label: E1
description: Alchemist's second solo record is future-horror music, a cinematic soundtrack that crosses sci-fi pastiche with hardheaded ignorance of underground street rap.

title: Ty Segall / Lemons
label: Castle Face
description: Sophomore release on Goner records builds confidently on the experimental, 1960s-inspired lo-fi rock of last year's self-titled debut.

title: jj n° 2
label: Sincerely Yours
description: Another mysterious outfit from Sweden making the kind of warm, sunny Balearic pop the region has become known for, but jj do it much better than most.

title: Lord Cut-Glass
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Delgados frontman Alun Woodward, co-leader of one of the decade's most criminally underrated bands, makes his solo debut.

title: Collaboratory
label: Poker Flat
description: Underrated DJ/producer offers another classicist fusion of deep house grooves, reflective post-Detroit synthesizer melodies, and slight electro affectations.

title: Gorgeous Johnny
label: Jagjaguwar
description: This San Franciscan duo returns with another record of Cali-fried folk and blissed-out Americana.

title: Rated O
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Only a band as inscrutable as Oneida would attempt a 3xCD in 2009; only a band brimming with this many ideas could pull it off.

title: Live From Austin, TX
label: New West
description: This CD/DVD set documents what is for the "ACL" TV show a raucous performance; for the Truckers, however, it's politely subdued.

title: A Lovely Sight
label: Numero Group
description: Turned on by the Beatles and the Doors, Pisces were a little-known 60s group from Rockford, Illinois, and are now Numero Group's latest excavation.

title: Azar
label: One Percent Press
description: Promising Athens, Ga., band continues to expand its sound in intriguing ways, here balancing its earthy chamber pop with forays into ambient electronics.

title: Legends of Benin
label: Analog Africa
description: Analog Africa continues its exceptional run of reissues with a compilation that highlights four bandleaders working out of the tiny West African country Benin.

title: VH1 Storytellers
label: Virgin
description: Based on the storytelling abilities he displays on this CD/DVD set, it's better David Bowie maintain the mystery.

title: Voltaic
label: One Little Indian
description: The latest extracurricular Björk release, this box of live DVDs and CDs, remix CD, and more does more to draw attention to Medúlla than to Volta.

title: The Stars Are Out
artist: Sarah Borges and the Broken Singles
label: Sugar Hill
description: Punk-spirited honky-tonker continues splitting time between writing and covering songs; here, tracks by Smokey Robinson, the Magnetic Fields, NRBQ, and others.

title: Hustle Beach
label: Lujo
description: Integration of FM-era pop, from glam to power pop, bandannaed cock-rock and New Romanticism, shouldn't come this easy, or sound this good.

title: Till Makabert Väsen
label: Hydra Head
description: Bergraven's latest continues down a path from black metal to dark rock with clean tones and bent melodies.

title: ...And the Ever Expanding Universe
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Arts & Crafts band hooks up with frequent A&C production wizard Dave Newfeld (BSS), who helps give its work more polish and beauty.

title: Ill Communication [Deluxe Edition]
label: Capitol
description: The Beastie Boys' expanded reissue campaign rolls on. Here, the underrated follow-up to Check Your Head is built out with quality B-sides and remixes.

title: Over and Over
label: Labrador
description: The shapeshifting project of Sweden's Johan Angergård (Club 8, Acid House Kings) returns to the live-band, fuzz-pop feel of its beloved first album.

title: Bandages for the Heart
label: Tapete
description: Throughout this LP of love songs, every moment sounds exaggerated, but at their best, Lacrosse replicate the drama of ordinary love with uncanny accuracy.

title: Music From the North Country: The Jayhawks Anthology
label: Legacy
description: Oddly, this is the first retrospective of any kind for the Jayhawks, one of the founding and key alt-country bands of the 1990s.

title: Drums of Passion
label: Sony
description: Nigerian drummer's highly influential 1959 debut is remastered and packaged with its 1966 companion piece and well-chosen extras on this 2xCD reissue.

title: Horehound
label: Third Man
description: Jack White teams with Alison Mosshart (the Kills) and members of QOTSA and his Raconteurs on this project, which delves deep into swampy blues rock.

title: Moondagger
label: Ghostly
description: Prolific bedroom auteur Randolph Chabot hires a backing band and finally releases his long-awaited Ghostly International debut.

title: Waxing Gibbous
label: Full Time Hobby
description: The former Arab Strap multi-instrumentalist, known for his black, oddball sense of humor, makes like he's fronting the E Street Band on his fifth solo album.

title: Well Known Pleasures
label: Vogue College
description: Alan Palomo's (Neon Indian, Ghosthuslter) VEGA project's Joy Division-like debut EP-- originally slated for May release-- is finally out digitally this month.

title: BLACKsummers'night
label: Columbia
description: One of 90s R&B's leading lights makes a surprising, and rewarding, comeback on this, his first new album in eight years.

title: Catacombs
label: Domino
description: The singer-songwriter's fourth full-length is both his most stripped-down effort to date and also his best.

title: My Son's Home
label: Autumn Tone
description: The shambling folk-rock group offers its fourth album, a record deeply, resolutely soaked in bodily and spiritual dissolution.

title: Killingsworth
label: Yep Roc
description: Young Fresh Fellows' Scott McCaughey and R.E.M.'s Peter Buck are joined by most of the Decemberists on their latest record of country-rock and Big Star pop.

title: Fox Bat Strategy: A Tribute to Dave Jaurequi
label: David Lynch Music
description: Recorded in 1994 by musicians that David Lynch worked with on Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me, the filmmaker is finally now releasing the record.

title: War Angel
label: self-released
description: This internet-only mixtape finds 50 Cent trying to peddle some "back to basics" shit that never actually figured in his career in the first place.

title: LP
label: XL
description: Vampire Weekend keyboardist Rostam Batmanglij and Ra Ra Riot singer Wes Miles put their own spin on modern R&B.

title: Golden Oldies / Shitgaze Anthems
label: Wasted Vinyl
description: Two collections of stray tracks and cast-offs from a band far more interested in the skronky part of the noise-pop equation.

title: Drift
label: Alpha Pup
description: Like Flying Lotus, Nosaj Thing has a great ear for odd, leftfield sounds and makes gorgeously haunted, glitch-y hip-hop.

title: Life on Earth
label: Sub Pop
description: Solemn folkie follows her 2007 debut Hands Across the Void with a record that revels in absences, silences, distances, and negative space.

title: Upper Air
label: Dead Oceans
description: Bowerbirds' second LP, Upper Air, is nearly a carbon copy of its predecessor, Hymns for a Dark Horse; that's a good thing.

title: Back to the Feature
label: self-released
description: Another excellent mixtape finds Wale reveling in an Everyman persona that skirts blue-collar connotations to embody an immersion in ESPN results and pop culture.

title: Ye Gods (And Little Fishes)
label: Sonny Boy
description: After a series of records credited to Brave Captain, the former Boo Radleys leader releases his first LP under his given name.

title: Anok Pe: Aleph at Hallucinatory Mountain
label: Coptic Cat
description: This guest-heavy album-- Andrew W.K., James Blackshaw, Rickie Lee Jones, porn star Sasha Grey-- is David Tibet's most rock-oriented to date.

title: Now I Am Champion
label: Common Cloud
description: Members of Islands and tUnE-YaRds collaborate on this eclectic and free-thinking project.

title: The Sound of UK Funky
label: Ministry of Sound
description: The most exciting strain of dance music the past 18 months, UK funky-- an offshoot of UK garage and grime-- finally gets a sprawling, solid introduction.

title: Hometowns
label: Saddle Creek
description: This affecting debut-- an underground hit for months, now out on Saddle Creek-- blends acoustic, nostalgic rock, energetic rhythms, and grand arrangements.

title: Music From the Atom Smashers
label: Ghostly
description: Rising Chicago DJ and house producer here also displays a considerable talent for creating experimental electronic music.

title: These Four Walls
label: Fat Cat
description: This debut by FatCat's latest Scottish discovery is exactly what you'd expect from the label that gave us the Twilight Sad and Frightened Rabbit.

title: American Central Dust
label: Rounder
description: The Rounder debut of Jay Farrar's long-running project contains some of the sleepiest protest music ever made.

title: Wu-Tang Chamber Music
label: E1
description: Only tangentially Wu-related, this brief, new collection is a hackneyed cash-grab, sure, but it's a pretty good hackneyed cash grab.

title: Wait for Me
label: Mute
description: Moby continues to explore gorgeous melodies, here shuffling through two decades' worth of easy-listening indie rock and easy-listening dance.

title: Royal City
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: A rarities collection from the inclusive Ontario outfit showcases a band whose finest quality was restraint.

title: The Guilty Office
label: Hidden Agenda
description: The Kiwi band has come back all the way on this, its first release since 2005's underwhelming return from a decade-long hiatus, At the National Grid.

title: Pulse of the People
label: Invasion
description: Hip-hop (no pun) vets return with a DJ Green Lantern-helmed mixtape, advocating for self-reliance and community empowerment by painting in broad strokes.

title: Fits
label: Full Time Hobby
description: Still displaying more promise than power, White Denim are thankfully able to slowly grow under the dim, fleeting spotlight of the Internet music world.

title: Reckoning [Deluxe Edition]
label: Interscope
description: The expanded reissues of albums from R.E.M.'s I.R.S. years continue, as the brilliant follow-up to Murmur is augmented with a 1984 live show.

title: UUVVWWZ
label: Saddle Creek
description: Nebraska band may still be figuring out what it wants to be, but the best moments here show promise.

title: Under and Under / The Fields EP
label: In the Red
description: Two releases from the proprietor of the lo-fi Captured Tracks imprint touch on goth, garage rock, and shoegaze.

title: Street Sweeper Social Club
label: Warner Bros.
description: Rage Against the Machine's Tom Morello teams with another agit-pop star, Boots Riley of the Coup, for a record of, you guessed it, political rap-rock.

title: Dillanthology 1: Dilla's Productions for Various Artists / Dillanthology 2: Dilla's Remixes for Various Artists
label: Rapster
description: A pair of comps-- one volume of original productions, one of Dilla-orchestrated remixes-- attempt to memorialize the life and career of the hip-hop producer.

title: Guns Don't Kill People-- Lazers Do
label: Downtown
description: Diplo and Switch recruit vocalists such as Santigold, the women of Nina Sky, Vybz Kartel, and more for an eclectic dancehall-heavy party record.

title: Super Animal Brothers III
label: Carpark
description: Homemade electronics. Baltimore. Day-glo analog synths. Glitchy drum machine. Childlike singing. You guessed it: this sounds like Dan Deacon.

title: ...At the Moment of Our Most Needing or If Only They Could Turn Around, They Would Know They Weren't Alone
label: Paper Bag
description: Latest album from the ambitious band takes an impressionistic tack, relying less on an overarching concept.

title: Depart From Me
label: Definitive Jux
description: Cage follows 2005's Hell's Winter, a harrowing emo-rap record, with an extended wallow in self-pity and self-loathing.

title: Last Choice EP
label: What's Your Rupture?
description: Love Is All continue to refine their sound and add variety and polish to their spastic post-punk core.

title: Octahedron
label: Warner Bros.
description: The ambitiously huge prog-rock band return with their most relatively accessible album in years.

title: Music of the Modern White
label: Social Registry
description: Brooklyn band's debut was an abrasive mix of avant-garde classical music, free jazz, and punk, but here they've loosened up, favoring atmosphere and texture.

title: So Far Gone
label: self-released
description: Ex-"Degrassi" star finds new levels of fame as a rapper via a mixtape complaining about his previous level of fame. Major labels drool; Lil Wayne guests.

title: Magnificence in the Memory
label: Drag City
description: A far-out comp culled from the unreleased archives of Father Yod's hippie L.A. religious sect by No Neck Blues Band member Dave Nuss.

title: Hot Buttered Soul
label: Stax
description: A revolutionary classic of soul music, four string-drenched epics, is reissued 40 years on, in a package that includes bonus tracks.

title: Wilco (The Album)
label: Nonesuch
description: Jeff Tweedy and co.'s latest does what its title implies, consolidating their eclectic style into a coherent statement of identity. Leslie Feist guests.

title: Against the Day
label: Constellation
description: Shalabi Effect's Sam Shalabi returns with a project that explores the dissection of popular Western sounds and 1960s Egyptian orchestral music.

title: Bestia
label: MUN
description: One of the leading lights of a rich vein of Mexican indie rock, Hello Seahorse! come off like a Western Hemisphere version of Los Campesinos!

title: Ganglians / Monster Head Room
label: Woodsist
description: Ganglians are the latest act on Brooklyn's Woodsist; over an EP and full-length, they craft a rough brand of psychedelia that leaves room for pastoral beauty.

title: A Psychedelic Guide to Monsterism Island
label: Lo
description: Artist and designer Pete Fowler drafts SFA's Gruff Rhys, Luke Vibert, and FSOL for a record full of of childlike mischief and spaced-out merriment.

title: Ambivalence Avenue
label: Warp
description: Incorporating elements of cut-up soul and hip-hop, this is a stunning transformation for a guy that seemed like a one-trick pony focused only on atmosphere.

title: World I See / The Way We Are
label: LOAF
description: Person Pitch and Sung Tongs producer Rusty Santos teams with members of Gang Gang Dance and White Magic to create a pair of art-rock records.

title: The Loud Wars
label: Vagrant
description: St. Louis band recalls D.C.'s turn of the century creative spark with a record that sounds as if could have come from late-90s DeSoto or Dischord.

title: Spoils
label: Drag City
description: Appendix Out driving force has made one of the best albums of his career, a varied set of folk-inspired originals with plenty of subtle surprises.

title: Varshons
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: Evan Dando's crew take on everyone from Wire to Gram Parsons, G.G. Allin to Christina Aguilera on this new covers album.

title: Beacons of Ancestorship
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Tortoise finally make their jam band record, but manage to wonderfully blend it with both the dance- and lounge-rooted aspects of their sound.

title: Someday This Could All Be Yours
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: This singular Dallas band turns in its most digestible work, but it's still an exploration of humankind's futile attempts to manage itself.

title: Travels With Myself and Another
label: 4AD
description: Ex-Mclusky guys create the finest soundtrack for slam dancing, fast driving, heavy drinking, or whatever poor decision you make this year.

title: Spinnerette
label: Anthem
description: Former Distillers singer Brody Dalle returns, with a new band that also features members of Pearl Jam and Eagles of Death Metal.

title: Music For Men
label: Columbia
description: Beth Ditto and co.-- already stars in the UK-- now take on the U.S. with their Rick Rubin-produced major-label debut.

title: Dragonslayer
label: Jagjaguwar
description: The brooding, cryptic world of Spencer Krug is more straightforward on the latest Sunset Rubdown LP, the easiest to digest of the prolific writer's career.

title: Larry Jon Wilson
label: Drag City
description: Drag City releases the first album in decades from this singer and songwriter, whose comeback recalls the Rick Rubin-produced LPs of Johnny Cash.

title: Wild Young Hearts
label: Mercury
description: Former UK buzz band follows its so-so debut with a record that is both better and more adventurous than its first.

title: Liquor Store Mascot
label: self-released
description: With disarming candor and a veteran's perspective, Atlanta's Playboy Tre, a B.o.B. associate, has made one of the hip-hop mixtapes of the year.

title: Far
label: Sire
description: Arrested development and affectation continues to define Regina Spektor's quirky music-making. An all-star roll of producers are on hand, including Jeff Lynne.

title: God Help the Girl
label: Matador
description: Belle and Sebastian's Stuart Murdoch plays pop svengali on the singer/songwriter's planned musical-film project. The Divine Comedy guests.

title: Sholi
label: Quarterstick
description: An album of proggy guitar suites with constantly shifting time signatures from a brainy band that covered Joanna Newsom last year.

title: Born on Flag Day
label: Partisan
description: On their second album, the rootsy rockers profiled by NBC's Brian Williams evoke a fairly healthy range of influences but run into some familiar problems.

title: Because I Was in Love
label: Language of Stone
description: Brooklyn's Sharon Van Etten displays the expressive voice and songwriting chops of peers such as Alela Diane, Marissa Nadler, and Jana Hunter.

title: Murdering Oscar (and Other Love Songs)
label: Ruth St.
description: Drive-By Trucker's second solo album features many songs written years ago, but the whole still hangs together and comes across as cohesive and sharp.

title: Farm
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Looks like Beyond was not a fluke: the latest from the reunited original line-up is jammed with well-crafted songs that never feel overly polished.

title: Some Sweet Relief
label: Carrot Top
description: Chicago quartet follows its pleasant yet indistinct debut with a record that points toward the work of Spiritualized and Mazzy Star.

title: The Camel's Back
label: Domino
description: Psapp play what's essentially cocktail jazz music with a strong indie-pop lean, occasionally hitting on something gorgeous.

title: The Freak of Araby
label: Drag City
description: Guitarist and Sun City Girls co-founder creates an impressive instrumental album that's instantly accessible but difficult to peg.

title: A Pipe Dream and a Promise
label: Interdependent Media
description: Detroit MC, armed with syllable-juggling flow and memorable lines, fits alongside Black Milk and Elzhi near the top of underground hip-hop's post-Dilla world.

title: Foxbase Alpha / Continental
label: Warner Bros.
description: The debut album and a rare odds-and-ends collection from the venerable UK group are reissued, providing further evidence of their versatile pop genius.

title: Passage
label: Troubleman Unlimited
description: Previous cassette and vinyl releases contained detours through dub waters, but here Pocahaunted offer a more focused expression of their clouded atmospherics.

title: Adaptations #1 Mixtape
label: Kompakt
description: Collecting original tracks along with remixes by and for the German producer, this is one of the most inviting techno albums you'll hear this year.

title: Black Meteoric Star
label: DFA
description: Gavin Russom, once teamed with Delia Gonzalez, goes his own way on his heavily nostalgic debut DFA album as Black Meteoric Star.

title: BlaQKout
label: Mad Science
description: Underrated hip-hop vets combine to make a surprising, disparate, and frequently brilliant record.

title: Hands
label: Atlantic
description: UK It Girl teams with members of Hot Chip, Simian Mobile Disco, and the Bird and the Bee on her much-anticipated debut.

title: Skeletons
label: Mute
description: Hipster stage parents begat teen indie band with predictable results.

title: I Was a King
label: Control Group
description: Norwegian power-pop band mines 1960s guitar pop, as well as the bands who have since done the same-- Big Star, Teenage Fanclub. Sufjan Stevens guests.

title: Over Air
label: Kora
description: A Dutch radio session is the source here for the band's hushed, glacial sound.

title: The Roots of El-B
label: Tempa
description: One of the stars of UKG and progenitors of dubstep gets a well-deserved Soul Jazz comp treatment.

title: The Archives Vol. 1: 1963-1972
label: Reprise
description: Twenty years since its first public mention, Archives-- covering 1963-72-- finally arrives as a 10-disc multimedia set available on DVD or Blu-ray.

title: Command
label: Out of Line
description: Ex-Dubstar singer and Alan McGee spouse return with their fourth album of frosty Eurodisco.

title: Embrace
label: ATP
description: San Fran-via-Santa Cruz sextet dispenses earth-quaking riffage in measured, spaced-out rations, tricking you into thinking it's heavier than it actually is.

title: Rhett Miller
label: Shout! Factory
description: Old 97's leader returns with another solo album that leans more toward sophisticated pop rather than his band's country tinged sound.

title: Underwaterpeoples Records Showcase
label: Underwater Peoples
description: Like a U.S. indie rock version of Sweden's Sincerely Yours, this comp, full of homespun pop, is at its best a wonderful collection of summer night sounds.

title: 1 Record / Radio City
label: Stax
description: Once a crucial 2-for-1 reissue, this new version of Big Star's classic, disparate records adds nothing to their legacy or discography.

title: En Hand I Himlen
label: Hybris
description: Swedish songwriter is a new romantic (not a New Romantic), with a bruised emotionalism and chilly synthcraft (but not ruffled shirts or heavy eyeliner).

title: Tape Chants
label: Kranky
description: Looking to break away from computer-based methods, the Oakland-based composer turns to cassette tapes for his latest set of Kranky drones.

title: Listening Tree
label: Warp
description: Tim Exile's third album and Warp debut trades on his genre-hopping (IDM, drum'n'bass, electro) to build aggressive, kinetic pop dramas.

title: So Cow
label: Tic Tac Totally
description: Collection of Irish multi-instrumentalist's self-released CDs and singles, compiled and remastered by Bob Weston, is full of sing-along hooks and scruffy charm.

title: A Bugged Out Mix
label: New State
description: Latest entry in the mix series camps in the purgatory between a taste-making dance set and a more eclectic pop collage.

title: Rotting Slowly
label: K
description: K Records band does unhurried psych-blues, autoharp ghost songs, and Area 51 garage-Americana.

title: Ciao!
label: PIAS
description: Montreal DJ/producer again enlists Soulwax for production assistance while James Murphy contributes songwriting and mixing.

title: Crossing the Rubicon
label: Original Signal
description: Swedish new-wave band long ago reached the point of no return.

title: Kitsuné Maison 7: The Lucky One
label: Kitsuné
description: Choice French label returns with another compilation, this time featuring Phoenix, Prins Thomas, La Roux, and the Golden Filter.

title: Jhelli Beam
label: Anti-
description: Technically impressive as always, Busdriver returns with another record that sounds like DOOM's cultural vocabulary funneled through Doseone's vocal dexterity.

title: The Mirror Explodes
label: Tee Pee
description: L.A. psychedelic revivalists have taken a darker and druggier turn on their latest, an album whose heavy lids bespeak a narrow vision.

title: Miike Snow
label: Downtown
description: Bloodshy & Avant, the Swedish production team behind Britney's "Toxic" and remixes for bands like Vampire Weekend, step out from behind the board.

title: All Reflections Drained
label: Hydra Head
description: Perhaps the biggest name in American black metal, Xashtur returns, revealing his long-cloaked identity but maintaining the mystery in his music.

title: Boys
label: City Slang
description: On her promising second album, this Nashville-based singer-songwriter looks to 1990s art-rock with an electronic tinge for inspiration.

title: The Bachelor
label: Bloody Chamber
description: One of the decade's true originals follows The Magic Position with his most populist record to date. Tilda Swinton guests as the voice of hope. Seriously.

title: Lose Your Illusion, Too
label: Flameshovel
description: Taking cues from the Replacements and peak-period punk, Chicago's Mannequin Men take decades-old rock tropes and pull them off.

title: My Electric Family
label: Drag City
description: Opening up emotionally and embracing new sounds and other musicians, Annabel Alpers' former one-woman project grows musically as well on her second LP.

title: Battle For the Sun
label: Vagrant
description: With a new ex-pop-punk drummer, a new label (Vagrant), and the help of a dude who produced Godsmack, this is meant to be a rejuvenation of the Placebo brand.

title: Mingus Ah Um: Legacy Edition
label: Legacy
description: A key album from the great bassist/composer/bandleader's canon is given an expanded 2xCD reissue that includes the complete album Mingus Dynasty.

title: The Ecstatic
label: Downtown
description: Rapper's first solo album in almost three years is a small-globe statement that jumps stylistically across continents on a hip-hop goodwill-ambassador tour.

title: Clangour
label: Morr
description: The one-man project of Sindri Már Sigfússon, this Morr release mixes predictable comforts with little anxieties and surprises.

title: False Face Society
label: Mexican Summer
description: More improvisational than her recent, excellent Kranky material, Honey Owens' latest is a limited-edition LP via vinyl- and digital-only boutique Mexican Summer.

title: Absu
label: Candlelight
description: After an eight-year absence, Absu return with an energizing record of black metal, bedrock thrash, symphonic flourishes, and arcane mythological references.

title: Man of Aran
label: Rough Trade
description: BSP take on Robert Flaherty's Man of Aran 75 years after its release, giving the proto-documentary a new, occasionally stunning soundtrack.

title: Bitte Orca
label: Domino
description: The challenging art-poppers led by Dave Longstreth have made their best and most accessible album, a record that's one of the year's real highlights.

title: Philadelphia Freeway 2
label: Real Talk
description: Still an incredible rapper, Freeway's third album-- which follows his month-long song-a-day blog leak from late last year-- is full of questionable decisions.

title: Survival Strategies in a Modern World
label: Slumberland
description: Latest signees to Slumberland are from Gothenburg, Sweden, and they faithfully recreate the sound of a highly specific strain of 1980s indie pop.

title: Vicious Circle / History Of
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Overlooked early-1980s Indianapolis band is given a thorough reissue treatment, proving once again that vital punk rock was being made all over.

title: West Ryder Pauper Lunatic Asylum
label: RCA
description: Still excelling when sticking to the unfashionable sound of electro-based rock, Kasabian, alas, also make the requisite "mature" moves on their third album.

title: The Eternal
label: Matador
description: A consolidation of the band's considerable strengths, much of the new SY album seems fixated on death, loss, and what little can be known about either.

title: All Is Wild, All Is Silent
label: Western Vinyl
description: Texas instrumental duo deftly draws from a wide, expected lexicon of folk, classical, jazz, and 20th century classical musicians.

title: Gentlemania
label: Sonig
description: Another left turn for the always interesting artist, this LP touches on theater and torch songs but feels closest to confessional singer-songwriter music.

title: Sketches of Spain: Legacy Edition
label: Legacy
description: Originally issued in 1960, this was Davis' studio follow-up to the landmark Kind of Blue and found him striking out in an entirely new direction.

title: The Dreams We Have as Children
label: Big Brother
description: A recording of a 2007 charity show finds Gallagher revisiting many classics from Oasis' most fruitful years and includes guest spots from Paul Weller.

title: Hombre Lobo: 12 Songs of Desire
label: Vagrant
description: Juke-joint pastiche and songs about hopelessness-- hey, it's the latest Eels record. His first LP of new music in four years.

title: Spirit Animal
label: Relapse
description: Badass instrumental rock group follow 2006's outstanding Surface to Air, a record that matched looming dread with body-rocking thunder.

title: Two Fingers
label: Paper Bag
description: Amon Tobin hooks up with producer Doubleclick and MC Sway for a satisfying album of brooding, atmospheric beat science.

title: Tyvek
label: Siltbreeze
description: Siltbreeze band offers what, for that lo-fi label, is a relatively clean record, with standouts held over from tour CD-Rs that enjoy their bump in fidelity.

title: The Singles, Vol. 7: 1970-1972
label: Hip-O Select
description: This set finds James Brown putting together a new band, mostly abandoning songs-as-we-know-them, and generally kicking ass.

title: Blood
label: Domino
description: The Scots offer an album-length dub version of their latest album Tonight created by former Mad Professor apprentice Dan Carey.

title: Odo Sanbra
label: self-released
description: Chicago-based group pays tribute to highlife's past while moving the form forward. Andrew Bird guests.

title: Mind the Drift
label: Hydra Head
description: Third LP in four years-- and second since becoming Melvins' members-- from the L.A./Seattle group, now a trio with the addition of guitarist Toshi Kasai.

title: Préliminaires
label: EMI
description: With the passing of Stooges guitarist Ron Asheton, Iggy returns to being a solo artist, issuing an LP he claims "comes dangerously near jazz."

title: Secret, Profane and Sugarcane
label: Hear Music
description: Recorded in Nashville, backed up by an acoustic string-band including Jim Lauderdale, this is sort of a mishmash of ideas, some kicking around for decades.

title: Grace Around the World
label: Columbia
description: Yet another Jeff Buckley excavation, this one more quantity than quality.

title: Here Anonymous
label: Dangerbird
description: Sophomore album from L.A.-based band explores the ins and outs of relationships over a moody backing; Silversun Pickups' Nikki Monninger guests.

title: Two
label: Nobody's Bizzness
description: A sequel of sorts to the pair's 2001 First Album shows how much has changed since electroclash's heyday.

title: Divisionals
label: Ecstatic Peace
description: Brooklyn-based duo returns with an album that doesn't quite match 2007's Saw a Halo but still shows their way with barbed, heavily textured sound.

title: Jay Stay Paid
label: Nature Sounds
description: Collection of unreleased material from the late producer runs the gamut from 90s Ummah-era loops to beats he put together from his hospital bed.

title: Further Complications
label: Rough Trade
description: Former Pulp frontman's Steve Albini-produced album is a jutting, joking, hard-riffing jolt filled with raw self-deprecation and some unintended problems.

title: The Happiness Project
label: Arts & Crafts
description: An intriguing release from the Broken Social Scene/Do Make Say Think member finds ordinary speech transformed into strange but affecting music.

title: Journal For Plague Lovers
label: Columbia
description: Built around lyrics from presumed-dead founding member Richey Edwards and recorded by Steve Albini, the Manics' latest finds them revitalized.

title: 21st Century, 21st Year
label: Luaka Bop
description: David Byrne's label celebrates 21 years in business with a comp that includes Tom Zé, Os Mutantes, Shuggie Otis, Zap Mama, and the proprietor himself.

title: II
label: Eskimo
description: After top-shelf work apart-- Lindstrøm's 2008 LP; Thomas' remixes-- the space disco pioneers re-team for a new record that bests their debut.

title: LeftRightLeftRightLeft
label: self-released
description: Coldplay are giving this LP away, but they could be selling it; at the very least, it eclipses their previous in-concert effort, Live 2003.

title: Amesoeurs
label: Profound Lore
description: The Profound Lore band broke up following the release of this, their only full-length, which represents a fervid last gasp of genre-melding creativity.

title: Psychic Psummer
label: Important
description: Cave specialize in pounding, hypnotic instrumental rock, and a track here called "High, I Am" hints at their inspiration.

title: theFREEhoudini
label: Anticon
description: Doseone and Jel throw an Anticon class reunion, with spots from friends and collective members including Slug, Aesop Rock, Why?, Buck 65, Alias, and Sole.

title: The Glass Bead Game
label: Young God
description: Gifted London-based guitarist and composer continues to expand his sound, here making greater use of piano as well as vocals, strings, and harmonium.

title: Monoliths & Dimensions
label: Southern Lord
description: Sunn O)))'s latest album may be their best, as dozens of collaborators join on four epic tracks that run from slow metal to shimmering orchestral drone.

title: Dim the Aurora
label: Misra
description: Austin-via-Dallas band distinguish themselves from other alt-country acts with an emphasis on powerful rhythms.

title: Untitled #23
label: Second Motion
description: Australian band best known in the U.S. for "Under the Milky Way" have kept at it all these years and are still making solid music here on their 23rd album.

title: Polly Scattergood
label: Mute
description: On her debut, this English singer-songwriter combines intimate themes with songs that start as ethereal ballads and build to a dramatic catharsis.

title: Gone Fishing
label: self-released
description: A new mixtape to bridge the gap until the Cool Kids' full-length debut has production from Don Cannon and guest spots from Ludacris, Bun B, and others.

title: Yesterday & Today
label: Kompakt
description: The Field follows his breakout album with one that splits the difference between more of the same and new ideas.

title: How to Get to Heaven From Scotland
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Former Arab Strap man continues to make music on par with that of his former band, here fronting an agglomeration of musical friends, the Best-Ofs.

title: Rose City
label: Barsuk
description: Portland husband-and-wife duo add a pair of members and pare down their songs, writing and recording this album in less than a month.

title: Ice Capped at Both Ends
label: Warp
description: Scott Herren (Prefuse 73) and Zach Hill (Hella) team for an LP surprisingly built on low-impact drones and whispery indie rock harmonies.

title: Dark Night of the Soul
label: self-released
description: Derailed by a murky copyright claim, Dark Night of the Soul is worth tracking down. Among the many guests are Wayne Coyne, Gruff Rhys, and James Mercer.

title: Wolfgang Amadeus Phoenix
label: Glassnote
description: Nearly 10 years into its career, the underrated French band has honed its sleek and increasingly effective bursts of pop to a fine point.

title: Wild and Inside
label: Siltbreeze
description: Though they've toned down a bit on their second LP, Eat Skull are still among the scuzziest, and best, of the recent crop of noise-pop bands.

title: Cryptomnesia
artist: El Grupo Nuevo de Omar Rodriguez-Lopez
label: self-released
description: First official release of new project from Mars Volta guitarist features two members of Hella and members of MV, including Cedric Bixler-Zavala.

title: Eating Us
label: Graveface
description: For their fourth album, this PA collective travels east to enlist the help of producer Dave Fridmann (Flaming Lis, Mercury Rev).

title: UGK 4 Life
label: Jive
description: Mostly recorded before Pimp C passed away in 2007, the final UGK album is steeped in the craft the duo took years to perfect.

title: Veckatimest
label: Warp
description: One of the year's most anticipated albums turns out to be worthy of the hype, as Grizzly Bear continue to expand their approach to lush chamber pop.

title: La Llama
label: Stones Throw
description: Expanded to a trio, Scott Herren's S&S moves to Stones Throw, thickens his music's mix, and revels in the sounds from the melting pot of 1970s Brazil.

title: Still Night, Still Light
label: Moshi Moshi
description: This Brooklyn trio's third LP is also its best-- feather-light electro-pop that's not to be taken lightly.

title: OK Bear
label: Lewis Hollow
description: Ex-Sunny Day Real Estate leader's third solo album locates emotional coherence in disjointed images and fragmentary phrases.

title: Manners
label: Columbia
description: Destined to be loved or hated, it's heartening how little Passion Pit concern themselves with decorum or trend-watching in search of an irresistible hook.

title: 21st Century Breakdown
label: Reprise
description: Like predecessor American Idiot, 21st Century Breakdown is another hour-plus slab of jumped-up alt-rock as political/musical theater.

title: Black Cascade / Malevolent Grain EP
label: Southern Lord
description: After two exceptional black metal records, Wolves in the Throne Room return this year with a new EP and LP.

title: Magnolia
label: Barsuk
description: The American Analog Set's Andrew Kenny returns with a muffled, precise set that recalls a slightly countrified Lindsey Buckingham.

title: Fantasy Ride
label: LaFace
description: After a stretch of wonderful, diverse singles, Ciara hunts high and low for a new hit and loses her already slippery identity in the process.

title: Yours Truly, The Commuter
label: Anti-
description: Recorded over three years, the former Grandaddy leader's debut LP sounds like... a Grandaddy album. Thankfully, a good one.

title: Rainwater Cassette Exchange
label: Kranky
description: The fourth Deerhunter-related release on Kranky since October, this five-song EP ranges from translucent psych-pop to pummeling garage-rock.

title: Kappe
label: Type
description: Latest from this Scandinavian doom artist sounds more like a depressed La Monte Young than an heir of metal ancestry.

title: Clues
label: Constellation
description: Ex-members of Arcade Fire and the Unicorns team for a record that's closer to the latter's skewed art pop than the former's stadium anthems.

title: Lost Channels
label: Nettwerk
description: Tony Dekker's project takes a swing at the big leagues with ambitious arrangements, slicker production, and a band that emerges front and center.

title: Eats Darkness
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Third album from the Toronto-based project contains stabs at indie rock, sample-based collage, and something in the neighborhood of dub reggae.

title: Around the Well
label: Sub Pop
description: This 2xCD rarities set covers Sam Beam's career from solo acoustic stuff to full-band songs; unlike most odds'n'sods collections, it isn't for fans only.

title: Death Control
label: Kill Shaman
description: With an exhaustive list of influences of sonic touchstones, this California one-man project is sprawling in ways only homemade record-geek types can be.

title: 'Em Are I
label: Rough Trade
description: Neurotic New York singer/songwriter's latest album again connects best through lyrical details.

title: It's Frightening
label: TBD
description: White Rabbits debuted in 2007 to Spoon comparisons; now they've doubled down on those by enlisting Britt Daniel as producer.

title: Romanian Names
label: Dead Oceans
description: Singer-songwriter John Vanderslice is consistent almost to a fault, but here he sounds relatively loose and natural, resulting in one of his better records.

title: Relapse
label: Aftermath
description: It's the return of the... Ah, wait, no way, you're kidding: Eminem's relapse is just an update of his shock tactics? It still beats most of Encore.

title: Fake Surfers
label: In the Red
description: Band led by A Frames drummer Lars Finberg here plays to extremes, casting a more pronounced British Invasion pop influence in warped lo-fi sonics.

title: Sewn Together
label: Megaforce
description: With their second album in three years-- and a healthy touring schedule-- the Kirkwood Brothers are well and truly all the way back.

title: The Spinning Top
label: Transgressive
description: Blur guitarist again teams with producer Stephen Street for this, his seventh (!) solo album.

title: Kitsuné Tabloid
label: Kitsuné
description: For the second volume in this Kitsuné series, Phoenix turn in a modest and loving mixtape full of songs aimed at pricking ears rather than popping eyeballs.

title: Animal Crack Box
label: Catsup Plate
description: Animal Collective sifted through hundreds of live recordings and practice tapes recorded between 2000 and 2003 to craft this 3xLP intro to their early years.

title: Tomorrow Today
label: LOAF
description: Ex-Plone man Billy Bainbridge has a tinge of retro-futurist fetishism, but he and Seeland partner Tim Felton's music pulls from a decidedly different pallette.

title: Free Drugs;-)
label: Female Fantasy
description: Part of a noisy new crop of Lenny Kaye acolytes, Harlem offer a charming to-hell-with-everything swagger.

title: Ballads
label: Staubgold
description: Percussionist Paul Wirkus and experimental electronic musician Ekkehard Ehlers breathe new life into glitch.

title: Funcrusher Plus
label: Definitive Jux
description: Reissue of 1997 album serves as a reminder of how advanced El-P, Bigg Jus, and DJ Mr. Len were at the time and how well their take on hip-hop holds up now.

title: Crime Pays
label: Asylum
description: We wanted a The Wrestler-style comeback that derived power from its protagonist's fall; instead, this LP has a lonely, defensive Kirk Van Houten vibe.

title: Modern Silence
label: Happy Happy Birthday to Me
description: Sometimes-inspired guitar pop band gets long in the tooth on their sprawling new album.

title: Hey Everyone!
label: Best Before
description: Glaswegian sextet Dananananaykroyd create a debut that, like Los Campesinos!, is liable to unite moshers and librarians.

title: Maker
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Three brothers in rural Virginia craft ambitious and iconoclastic music that incorporates Southern rock, soul, and avant-garde elements.

title: Intimacy Remixed
label: Wichita
description: In its original form, Intimacy already sounded like an overstuffed remix of a rock record, but here we go with another attempt at making it any good.

title: Wavering Radiant
label: Ipecac
description: L.A.'s Isis have a way of transforming contemporary guitar rock into music flush with fresh emotions and ideas, and this is their smartest and richest record.

title: Wooden Arms
label: Secret City
description: Polaris Prize winner offers an album of left turns, the album's classicist leanings cut with a more organic vibe.

title: When I See the Sun Always Shines on TV
label: The End
description: Toronto metal-gaze duo doesn't shrink from a challenge on this covers LP, taking on MBV, Elliott Smith, Swans, the Cure, and more.

title: Black Square
label: Impose
description: The band name is getting these guys attention, but their hyphenate-heavy take on math-rock, hardcore, and electronic noise is also head-turning.

title: Délivrance
label: Leaf
