description: As-ever inspired by the folk traditions of Eastern Europe, here Jeremy Barnes' outfit reaches a new level of exuberance.

title: Quicken the Heart
label: Warp
description: As the title implies, Maxïmo Park have realized they're better with rapid tempos than with conventional balladry and melodicism.

title: Down With Liberty... Up With Chains!
label: K
description: New project from Ian Svenonius (Nation of Ulysses, Weird War) recalls his late-90s material with the Make-Up and is the best thing he's done since.

title: Desire Lines
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Debut album from London/Oslo trio on the Smalltown Supersound label blends the peculiar lounging of Balearic disco with folky acoustic touches.

title: Blood From a Stone
label: Nettwerk
description: With found instruments and dense sounds, this Norwegian musician's tightly orchestrated pop can be so intricate that it becomes interactive.

title: Townes
label: New West
description: The culmination of a three-and-a-half-decade admiration, Steve Earle's latest is a Townes Van Zandt cover album.

title: Lost Verses Live
label: Caldo Verde
description: A mostly solo acoustic affair, the Red House Painters man's newest live recording is similar in feel to last year's sparse mini-album 7 Songs Belfast.

title: Checkmate Savage
label: Chemikal Underground
description: Scottish band's debut isn't too far off from what some would call "dad rock"-- if your dad happened to have Neu! or Beefheart records stashed somewhere.

title: Enter the 37th Chamber
label: Fat Beats
description: Wu-affiliated project offers an instant rap-geek curio for anyone who likes hearing bands cross the bounds of sample-based and live hip-hop instrumentation.

title: We Be Xuxa
label: Post Present Medium
description: Overdue for increased attention, this female five-piece specializes in a brash mixture of classic punk, hardcore thrash, and skronky no wave.

title: Vs. Children
label: Tomlab
description: Wherein Owen Ashworth fixates on doomed outlaws and comes to terms with what happens when you're not alone anymore.

title: Are You In?
label: Nike
description: Nike's Original Run series continues with De La Soul, who are using a late-career corporate sponsorship opportunity to soundtrack your next 45-minute jog.

title: Mind Raft
label: Lovepump United
description: Dirty Projectors bassist and co-vocalist strikes out on her own with a five-song EP of slow, droning, R&B-influenced folk.

title: Ascenseur Ouvert!
label: Odessa
description: More subdued and sophisticated Southern folk-pop from this North Carolina band, which has been both consistent and overlooked for almost a decade.

title: The Atlantic Ocean
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Picking up where last year's head-turning Ground Trouble Jaw EP left off, Richard Swift here continues his exploration of strutting, blue-eyed soul.

title: Entertainment
label: Lo
description: This New York-based art project made its mark during the first wave of electroclash and now returns with its first full-length album in four years.

title: Arctic Monkeys at the Apollo
label: Domino
description: Sheffield band teams with filmmakers behind "The Mighty Boosh", This Is England, and Sigur Rós' Heima for a concert DVD and its accompanying CD.

title: Automat EP / East Central One EP
label: Woebot
description: Former longtime and highly respected blogger Woebot releases 3" CDs, full of music leaning on the bass-heavy history of modern British dance music.

title: T.I.M.E. Soundtrack
label: Anticon
description: Odd Nosdam's latest has enough polish and structure to appeal to non-Anticon fans, but also a crate-digger vibe to please those into the avant-hip-hop label.

title: Primary Colours
label: XL
description: Much-derided and hyped UK band takes an unexpected, and rewarding, left turn on its second album. Portishead's Geoff Barrow co-produces.

title: Balf Quarry
label: Drag City
description: Continuing in the vein of 2007's BOSS, Magik Markers here channel their noisy leanings into simpler songs without sacrificing the band's fiery energy.

title: Set 'Em Wild, Set 'Em Free
label: Dead Oceans
description: After weathering a lineup change and a move from Young God to Dead Oceans, the always surprising art-rock group's new album carries an air of perseverance.

title: Replica Sun Machine
label: Wall of Sound
description: Danger Mouse helms this release, which fetishizes 20th century consumer culture, while adopting the same generic approach toward musical style.

title: A Ways Away
label: K
description: Ex-Rodan bassist makes her K Records debut with a new LP that draws together her considerable experience as a producer, singer, and a songwriter.

title: I Feel Cream
label: XL
description: Electroclash holdover's latest both points to new directions and recalls the strengths displayed on debut LP The Teaches of Peaches.

title: Sun Gangs
label: Rough Trade
description: The third full-length from this emotionally charged UK/New Zealand rock outfit finds frontman Finn Andrews fully realizing the expressive power of his voice.

title: From Her to Eternity / The First Born Is Dead / Kicking Against the Pricks / Your Funeral... My Trial
label: Mute
description: Band's first four albums are given expanded reissues.

title: Technicolor Health
label: Gigantic
description: New York's Harlem Shakes offer a take on today's fashionable guitar sounds-- a fusion of folk, global-pop, and good ol' fashioned indie rock.

title: Coming From Reality
label: Light in the Attic
description: This once-forgotten Detroit singer-songwriter mellows out on his second reissued album.

title: The Snake
label: Leaf
description: Swedish two-piece, whose music consists mostly of voice and percussion, continues to push its skeletal set-up into intriguing new realms.

title: Enter the Vaselines
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop's new 2xCD set of remastered originals and extras gives listeners an opportunity to reevaluate this Kurt Cobain-loved band on its own terms.

title: Actor
label: 4AD
description: This fine second album from Annie Clark's project finds the one-time member of Sufjan's band sharpening her songwriting and expanding her arrangements.

title: More
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Baltimore's Double Dagger are continuing to search for nuance in minimalism via punk rock.

title: Outside Love
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Side project of Black Mountain's Stephen McBean this time includes contributions from members of Godspeed You! Black Emperor and Jackie O Motherfucker.

title: Help
label: In the Red
description: San Fran fixture John Dwyer continues to successfully use Thee Oh Sees to explore his deep love of 1960s psychedelic and garage rock.

title: Invisible Cities
label: Ubiquity
description: Serving as something of a breath-catching release for this restless band, Invisible Cities nicely sums up its mix of Afrobeat and future funk.

title: Outer South
artist: Conor Oberst and the Mystic Valley Band
label: Merge
description: Working as a true ensemble player, Conor Oberst here cedes songwriting and vocal duties to others on a sizable portion of his new LP.

title: Remind Me Where the Light Is
label: Eenie Meenie
description: Moody yet unobtrusive, Great Northern's music is evocative of something but we're not exactly sure what that something is.

title: Peri
label: Three Lobed
description: Underground psych-rock vets continue to clear the vaults, unearthing prime jams and outtakes from the 1996-2001 era.

title: Grandes Exitos
label: self-released
description: A well-chosen tour-only "Greatest Hits" set from the inscrutable lo-fi singer/songwriter is, surprisingly enough, fully listenable from start to finish.

title: Broken Record Prayers
label: What's Your Rupture?
description: This 20-song collection of the underrated UK band's decade of output provides a timely and carefully filtered introduction to its discography.

title: Celebración de la Ciudad Natal
label: ATO
description: This double live 10" released on Record Store Day pulls songs from 2001's At Dawn up through 2008's Evil Urges.

title: Summer of Hate
label: Fat Possum
description: Split between 80s noise-pop and synth-pop, Crocodiles present their smartest work on the album's OMD-like ballads.

title: Tragic Boogie
label: Arena Rock
description: The Life and Times have attempted to imbue their music with a sound and swagger enormous enough to theoretically fill any venue imaginable.

title: The Complete Motown Singles, Vol. 11A: 1971/The Complete Motown Singles, Vol. 11B: 1971
label: Hip-O Select
description: Hip-O Select's exhaustively annotated and beautifully packaged series of boxed sets continues with 10 discs worth of material from 1971.

title: The Sleeping Bag Sessions
label: Traffic Entertainment
description: Alas, this is the least interesting-- and certainly the least revelatory-- posthumous Arthur Russell collection yet released.

title: Together Through Life
label: Columbia
description: Dylan again sounds like a one-man preservation society, exploring popular song traditions that halted around the release of his own first record in 1962.

title: Ape School
label: Counter
description: This one-man project specializes in jaunty, hazy psychedelia indebted to the Silver Apples and other early innovators of electronic instrumentation.

title: Colonia
label: Nettwerk
description: The Cardigans' vocalist Nina Persson's second album as A Camp finds her moving toward a sound that's more regal and urbane.

title: Shout at the Döner
label: Tigerbeat6
description: Latest from Kid606 is a hell of a lot of fun-- a rough, dirty party album, a trawl through two decades of abusive bass and dancefloor bad taste.

title: Tinted Windows
label: S-Curve
description: You know who's inside: James Iha (Smashing Pumpkins), Adam Schlesinger (Fountains of Wayne), Bun E. Carlos (Cheap Trick), and Taylor Hanson.

title: Fate to Fatal
label: self-released
description: The Breeders return (yes, so quickly!) with a four-song EP that features Mark Lanegan and includes a Bob Marley cover.

title: More Heart Than Brains
label: Anticon
description: This Postal Service-style collaboration teams Belgian-based producer Joëlle Phuong Minh Lê and Canadian indie-rap artist Richard Terfry (Buck 65).

title: Thunderheist
label: Big Dada
description: Toronto duo attempt to carry the blogosphere goodwill earned from "Sueños Dulces" and "Jerk It" over the course of a full album.

title: Purpleface
label: Secretly Canadian
description: After the almost-breakthrough Moonbeams, Throw Me the Statue return with an EP that explores their more maudlin tendencies.

title: Touchdown
label: Fat Cat
description: More unpretentious, smart, straight-no-chaser rock from this UK outfit, which includes former members of British Sea Power and the Electric Soft Parade.

title: A Cabinet of Curiosities
label: Rhino
description: This 4xCD set-- two CDs of demos/rarities, a third of a 1990 live show, and a DVD of video ephemera-- helps celebrate Jane's original-member reunion.

title: Honey Moon
label: Carrot Top
description: Latest from these indie vets isn't country gothic doom but rather love songs-- odes to sex, devotion, redemption, sacrifice, and more sex.

title: The Black Dirt Sessions
label: Three Lobed
description: True to form for him, the latest from solo folk guitar player Jack Rose is a mix of new and reworked material.

title: Moderat
label: Bpitch Control
description: Seven years on from a rough collaboration, Modeselektor and Apparat give it another go, aiming to combine their very individual styles into something striking.

title: Everything She Touched Turned Ampexian
label: Warp
description: A mosaic of rhythmic snippets and melodic scribbles, most averaging a minute or less, this LP is in the tradition of the single-artist album as DJ set.

title: Post-Nothing
label: Unfamiliar
description: Guitar/drums band from Vancouver makes terminally catchy music played with punk's enthusiasm and velocity that makes you feel like joining in to bash along.

title: High on Jackson Hill
label: Mint
description: Led by Brooke Gallupe and New Pornos touring member Kathryn Calder, this indie band explores doomsday forecasts and caustic reprimands on its latest album.

title: Wyllt
label: Tee Pee
description: The debut LP from this Tee Pee band is a fascinating compendium of the last 30 years of rock, from Zep and Sabbath through to Soundgarden and Isis.

title: Constant Hitmaker / God Is Saying This to You
label: Woodsist
description: Kurt Vile has absorbed a lifetime's worth of 70s FM rock, and the ghosts of Springsteen and others glimmer under the surface of his woozy bedroom pop.

title: I Do Not Want What I Haven't Got [Limited Edition]
label: EMI
description: Sinead O'Connor's breakthrough is the latest record to receive the deluxe treatment, adding a bonus disc that pointed to her future detours and quirks.

title: Songs of Shame
label: Shrimper
description: They share a label and lo-fi bent with groups like Vivian Girls, but Woods focus on a more pastoral and rustic vein of songcraft to beautiful effect.

title: Are Men
label: Tee Pee
description: This New York-by-way-of-Georgia act creates boozy, rowdy, loud country-rock.

title: Mythomania
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Former Deerhoof guy Chris Cohen releases the latest from his new, Sufjan Stevens-approved project.

title: Mean Everything to Nothing
label: Favorite Gentlemen
description: Atlanta-area band beefs up its sound considerably, aided by producer Joe Chiccarelli, who recently helmed records by the Shins and My Morning Jacket.

title: Yes
label: Astralwerks
description: The Pet Shop Boys grow up awkwardly, embracing sincerity and scoffing at dancefloor trends.

title: One Foot in the Grave
label: Interscope
description: This set of ramshackle folk songs did as much to create the slacker ethos as Beck's more well-known 1994 release, Mellow Gold. It's also almost as good.

title: Kicks
label: Rough Trade
description: Glasgow band with herky-jerky guitar riffs and plenty of sneering attitude returns with a second album, once again produced by Bernard Butler.

title: Never Gonna Touch the Ground
label: Ernest Jenning
description: This multinational party band based out of San Francisco infuses every moment of its full-length debut with movement.

title: Winter Hours
label: Black Hen
description: Harmony-heavy Canadian alt-country band channels influences like Gram Parsons and the Band on songs that speak to current economic hardships.

title: Asleep in the Bread Aisle
label: Universal Motown
description: Y'all act like you've never seen a white person before.

title: Sounds of the Universe
label: Mute
description: The days of Zeitgeist-shifting Depeche Mode awesomeness may likely be behind them, but that doesn't make their new LP less worthy of the band's legacy.

title: Worldwild
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Pterodactyl play a familiar brand of exuberant, sunburned psychedelic-inspired indie-- not too far off from labelmates Oneida.

title: Suckers EP
label: IAMSOUND
description: This increasingly whispered-about Brooklyn four-piece shares sonic similarities with Yeasyer, and could soon follow them to indie success.

title: The Planets Are Blasted
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: Two albums in, Robert Pollard's new band is proving to be the vehicle for some of his best music since the dissolution of Guided by Voices.

title: Art Brut vs. Satan
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: Recorded on the fly with ex-Pixie Frank Black, Art Brut vs. Satan is Eddie Argos' scrappy, romantic, and painfully hilarious return to loserdom.

title: My Maudlin Career
label: 4AD
description: Latest from these Glaswegian indie-poppers blends 1950s beach music, country, and bubbly orch-pop to complement their alternately romantic and cynical lyrics.

title: Mother of Curses
label: Tizona
description: Todd Rittman of 90s cult act U.S. Maple has a new band, and he's still interested in finding new ways to deconstruct rock.

title: You Can Have What You Want
label: Gnomonsong
description: Papercuts leader Jason Quever again crafts his aesthetic from the raw materials of Zombies, Velvet Underground, and Galaxie 500.

title: Black Monk Time / The Early Years (1964-1965)
label: Polydor
description: Light in the Attic keeps up its winning streak, reissuing one of the most underrated albums of the 1960s, as well as rate work from the uncompromising Monks.

title: Infinity +1
label: Thrive
description: If you want to hear what constitutes the midpoint between popular and underground dance music right now, this immaculately beatmatched mix could tell you.

title: Dark Days/Light Years
label: Rough Trade
description: The restlessly creative Welsh band returns with its finest album since 2001's Rings Around the World.

title: Old Stories
label: Midwich
description: Member of English folk collective the Memory Band makes her full-length solo debut, a mix of original and traditional songs set to spare arrangements.

title: Agorapocalypse
label: Relapse
description: Agoraphobic Nosebleed are one of the few metal bands that actually were extreme; here, however, they deliver listenable songs at rather normal lengths.

title: Dusk
label: Saddle Creek
description: Post-hardcore four-piece from Omaha works with Mastodon producer Matt Bayles to construct a sonically punishing version of the soul-baring Saddle Creek sound.

title: Let's Stay Together / I'm Still In Love With You / Greatest Hits
label: Fat Possum
description: Fat Possum reissues three records from Al Green's legendary Hi catalogue, two of which now stand as stone classics of 1970s soul.

title: Sometimes I Wish We Were an Eagle
label: Drag City
description: Bill Callahan's second post-Smog album feels unusually intimate and contains some of the most varied arrangements of his career.

title: Dance Mother
label: IAMSOUND
description: After two well-received singles and a year of constant buzz, this Brooklyn duo finally issues its Dave Sitek-produced debut.

title: Dos
label: Holy Mountain
description: Drawing on krautrock, Spacemen 3, and pretty much any music reliant on repetition, Wooden Shjips deliver on the promise of their debut EP.

title: Early Works for Me If It Works For You II
label: Phthalo
description: Jimmy Tamborello compiles his pre-Postal Service work as Dntel, adding previously unreleased material recorded circa Life Is Full of Possibilities.

title: I Heard It Today
label: Bloodbot Tactical Enterprises
description: This thoughtful, earnest, cerebral MC might be a prototypical "rapper liberal arts kids like," but he's also ferociously on-point and prodigiously skilled.

title: Pablo Honey: Collector's Edition / The Bends: Collector's Edition / OK Computer: Collector's Edition
label: Capitol
description: Radiohead's first three albums are given expanded 2xCD reissues.

title: When Sweet Sleep Returned
artist: The Assemble Head in Sunburst Sound
label: Tee Pee
description: Despite their stoner-rock bonafides, Assemble Head's new album-- while still fairly powerful-- seems to be reining in their more chaotic tendencies.

title: The Last Kiss
label: Def Jam
description: Jada's reputation as a rapper is secure-- Eminem and Q-Tip named him to their top 10 of all time-- but he's never been able to put together a truly solid LP.

title: Jigsaw
label: EMI
description: Free of Def Jam's expectations and Feminem marketing angles, Lady Sovereign gamely tries again.

title: Jewellery
label: Rough Trade
description: London group's debut, produced by Matthew Herbert, is a chaotic mess that also happens to be one of the freshest things to come along so far in 2009.

title: Kingdom of Rust
label: Heavenly
description: Doves' fourth album is another sterling example of why Doves should be household names and why they probably won't ever be.

title: Good Evening
label: Human Ear
description: Like Chromatics and Junior Boys, Nite Jewel makes dance music more suitable for the ride home from the club than the actual disco.

title: Life and Times
label: Anti-
description: While it's unfair to saddle Bob Mould with the same ol' "best album since..." cross, Life and Times does manage to reflect each facet of his career.

title: Swoon
label: Dangerbird
description: Silversun Pickups, who generated more Smashing Pumpkins comparisons than any band this side of Zwan with their 2006 debut Carnavas, return for Album #2.

title: Great Lengths
description: Dutch producer Martyn is one of dubstep's most versatile talents, and his debut album shows a varied interpretation of the sound's possibilities.

title: Check Your Head: Deluxe Edition
label: Capitol
description: The landmark album gets a remaster and a reissue, complete with a sadly inessential bonus disc of remixes and B-sides.

title: Oohs & Aahs
label: Barsuk
description: Singer-songwriter Eric Elbogen, who formerly worked under the name Say Hi to Your Mom, returns for a sixth album of one-man band indie pop.

title: Space Programs
label: Load
description: Caught between hippie repose and punk venom, TUSAIAM's politics and unforgiving posture toward history is more American than the machines it rages against.

title: Total Pop! Deluxe Box
label: Mute
description: A sequel to the solid Pop! singles comp, this 3xCD/DVD collection adds a live disc plus 17 years' worth of tracks you may not realize even existed.

title: Fantasies
label: MMI
description: After four years, Broken Social scenester Emily Haines' primary band finally releases a set of new material.

title: Lotusflow3r / MPLSound / Elixer
label: NPG
description: Three discs' worth of new Prince material-- one credited to his new protégé Bria Valente-- sold only online or through Target. Yikes.

title: O+S
label: Saddle Creek
description: Orenda Fink (former Azure Ray) teams with Cedric LeMoyne (former Remy Zero) for a dream-pop project on Saddle Creek.

title: Play Music
label: Fantasy Memory
description: International electro-pop group got its start via Kitsuné and finally has its debut LP released in the U.S.

title: The Love Language
label: Bladen County
description: Like Wavves and Times New Viking, this band uses lo-fi as a filter for pop sensibilities, though its approach is friendlier and less abrasive than those acts.

title: Leaves in the Gutter / Like It or Not
label: Merge
description: Superchunk return to the studio for the first time in almost a decade, plus Merge unearths tracks from Mac McCaughan's former band, Wwax.

title: Two Suns
label: Astralwerks
description: A significant step forward from her debut, Natasha Khan's Two Suns is home to some of the year's most thrilling music so far.

title: A Fool For Everyone
label: Social Registry
description: Still on the excellent Social Registry label, Mike Bones' latest is decidedly more rock and less indie.

title: Songs About Dancing and Drugs
label: !K7
description: Jeremy Shaw and crew explore the communal aspects of art and music; ironically, it's best suited to being heard with a good set of headphones.

title: Jet Black
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Toronto indie-rock scene vet crafts a very likable pop album for, you guessed it, Arts & Crafts.

title: Repo
label: Paw Tracks
description: The latest from this Brooklyn art-noise band continues their analytical zeal while also expanding a more realized sound.

title: Score! Twenty Years of Merge Records: The Covers
label: Merge
description: Merge continues its 20th anniversary festivities with a comp of non-label artists-- Bright Eyes, Shins, New Pornos-- covering songs from its catalog.

title: Fear Draws Misfortune
label: Cuneiform
description: Veteran Chicago post-rock outfit indulges its prog instincts, piling on the keyboards and busting out the crazy time signatures.

title: Telekinesis!
label: Merge
description: This power-pop debut echoes the Shins, Fountains of Wayne, Sloan, and Teenage Fanclub without directly lifting from anyone in particular.

title: Baby Charles
label: Record Kicks
description: Soul revivalists from Brighton, England, manage a loose and funky vibe so palpable you can't believe their debut wasn't recorded in the 1970s.

title: The Last Laugh
label: Team Love
description: A long-simmering project between producer Danger Mouse and London-born, Greek-descended folkie Helena Costas finally gets its Team Love release.

title: Begone Dull Care
label: Domino
description: Continuing the straightforward synthetic soul of So This Is Goodbye, Junior Boys' third LP is lush-- sometimes to the point of textural overload.

title: Join the Q
label: Ninja Tune
description: The Qemists follow the tradition of post-"Firestarter" bandwagoneers coming up with a lowest-common-denominator notion of, ugh, "rocktronica."

title: Ritual and Education / From an Ancient Star
label: Ghost Box
description: The London label Ghost Box compiles some of its askew psychedelica, plus the new album from one of its top artists, Belbury Poly.

title: Watersports
label: Quarterstick
description: Two former members of D.C. clatterers Black Eyes head out to San Francisco and regroup for a satisfying album of dubby and spaced-out post-punk.

title: Trailer Park: Legacy Edition
label: Legacy
description: The UK folkie's Wiliam Orbit-produced LP gets the remastered, reissued, and expanded treatment, and it turns out to be a pleasant surprise.

title: A Positive Rage
label: Vagrant
description: One of the best live bands on the planet offers a live CD/DVD package recording during its late-2007 Boys and Girls in America victory lap.

title: Inside Your Guitar
label: 4AD
description: As its name suggests, this group specializes in warm, gentle songs that return a listener's affection.

title: Scramble
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Suicide Squeeze's politcally aware, all-grrl Atlanta quartet are making sure the revolution will not be such a drag.

title: Local Customs: Downriver Revival
label: Numero Group
description: Latest from Numero compiles the work of Ohio basement/studio Double U, and the highlight is a DVD with a 30-minute documentary and over 200 extra tracks.

title: Born Like This
label: Lex
description: Once a prolific indie hip-hop fixture on the verge of reaching a critical and commercial mass, Daniel Dumile finally makes a proper, potent return.

title: Tentacles
label: Touch and Go
description: Crystal Antlers' proper debut-- the last new record on Touch and Go for the foreseeable future-- is, more than their EP, a focused, monochromatic record.

title: DJ Skee Presents: The Best of the Hamiltonization Process
label: self-released
description: Highly promising Brooklyn MC has inspired (and even inspiring) moments on his "best of" mixtape.

title: BiRd-BrAiNs
label: Marriage
description: Like the best lo-fi music, this debut LP manages to convey a sense of intimacy, as if it's a one-to-one conversation between the artist and the listener.

title: One
label: Ostgut Ton
description: Where many DJs and producers aim for aggressively minimal compositions, Berlin-based artist Ben Klock flips the equation on his full-length debut.

title: Nigeria 70: The Definitive Story of 1970’s Funky Lagos
label: Strut
description: After a year chock full of amazing West African 1970s reissues, the classic and crucial Nigeria 70 comp is reissued.

title: Ten: Deluxe Edition
label: Epic
description: A key template for almost two decades of mainstream rock is reissued with a new mix, extra songs, and a DVD of the group's "MTV Unplugged" show.

title: Capades
label: Social Science
description: Alex Lilly, backup singer for the Bird and the Bee, here gathers much of the supper-club chamber-pop she's been playing around L.A. for the past few years.

title: Pop Ambient 2009
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt's dependable compilation series, again curated by Wolfgang Voigt, returns with another balm for the post-winter blues.

title: Laughing Boy
label: Dicristina
description: One half of Metallic Falcons, New York-based songwriter gathers a cast of Chicago indie all-stars to help craft this solo record.

title: Raise / Mezcal Head
label: Creation
description: Oft-overlooked outfit reissues two early-1990s albums with bonus tracks, giving another chance to hear its more biting and direct approach to shoegaze.

title: 25 O'Clock / Psonic Psunspot
label: Virgin
description: XTC alter-egos, the Dukes may have begun as a joke, but this joke band's records rank with their creators' best work.

title: Baby
label: Burnt Toast Vinyl
description: Bosque singer Mara Lee Miller comes across like Texas' answer to Beth Gibbons, with her cold, ghostly timbre wrapped up in a strong country twang.

title: Dirty Bomb
label: Soot
description: Barcelona-via-Seattle DJ offers a diverse world-music inspired mix-- hip-hop, spiced-up rai, funk carioca, dubstep, dancehall-- that plays deep in the margins.

title: Beauties Never Die
label: Afternoon
description: Siri Ålberg takes a left turn away from her guitar-driven rock, toying with computers, synths, and live instruments to animate these diverse tracks.

title: Rules
label: Bubbles
description: Kings of Convenience head Erlend Øye returns in his electro-pop guise with a slightly more warm and human album than this project's debut.

title: Crack the Skye
label: Reprise
description: Mastodon follow the amazing Leviathan/Blood Mountain 1-2 with a Brendan O'Brien-produced LP that mixes more rock and prog into their metal core.

title: Black Boy White Boy
label: self-released
description: Young Dro is an interesting case: An MC who sounds more engaged and alive when he's rapping about his cars than when he's dealing with more weighty subjects.

title: A New Tide
label: ATO
description: Still going, still actually very popular, these UK Ameriphiles promise yet another reinvigorated approach with this LP title.

title: Soundboy's Gravestone Gets Desecrated By Vandals
label: Skull Disco
description: Split into one CD of original tunes and one CD of remixes, the latest set of Skull Disco's dubstep retains the label's now-identifiable sound.

title: Now We Can See
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Here the Thermals buff their fuzzy riffs into polished power-pop, which casts a much-deserved spotlight on Hutch Harris' keen lyrics.

title: Living Thing
label: Wichita
description: The Swedish trio follows its newfound pop success with more pronounced nods to left-field and international influences.

title: Dirtbox EP / When Machines Exceed Human Intelligence
label: Warp
description: Australian producer filters the modern Motor City hip-hop sound through textures associated with vintage electronic devices.

title: Vignetting the Compost
label: Mush
description: Beginning in the orbit of Boards of Canada, Stephen Wilkinson has taken his guitar and woozy effects further in the direction of trad song-based British folk.

title: Bloomed / The Hill / Impasse
label: Merge
description: With reissues of three early, out-of-print albums, Merge reintroduces us to some of Richard Buckner's songs.

title: Bunny Gets Paid [Deluxe Edition]
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop reissues the proto-Califone band's high-water mark, in a deluxe edition with a bonus disc, and 14 years on, it's aged beautifully.

title: A Woman a Man Walked By
label: Island
description: Harvey's second co-billed album with John Parish shows many divergent sides of the singer, in a sense amounting to an audition reel full of character studies.

title: Walk on Thin Air
label: Alyosha
description: Yes, Leonard Cohen is an inspiration for this noir-ish act that takes its name from his 1974 album.

title: Rearrange Beds
label: Mom & Pop
description: Australian duo and Tegan and Sara associates break out with a record that turns the introspective into the anthemic.

title: Matter and Light
label: self-released
description: This subdued orchestral folk-rock band must have been pretty pissed off when Arcade Fire came around.

title: The Future Will Come
label: DFA
description: Like most good DFA full-lengths, this album has post-disco dance-pop aesthetics intersecting and merging in ways that transcend cheap retro.

title: Beware
label: Drag City
description: For the second year in a row, Will Oldham drops a fully-formed, gorgeously wrapped disc with little buildup.

title: Winter Hours
label: Relapse
description: Well, here's a sensation we don't get to experience much: Hearing a new metal album and wishing the songs were longer.

title: Real Recognize Real
label: Hypnotize Minds
description: Since he got out of prison in 2005, this Memphis MC has quietly churned out three solo albums, each harder and darker than the last.

title: Rockwell
label: 4AD
description: Recorded with Steve Albini, the debut full-length from this classically trained artist is far closer to her confident live shows than previous recordings.

title: Histoire de Melody Nelson
label: Light in the Attic
description: Almost unbelievably, the French master's best work was out of print in North America. Light in the Attic rectifies that error.

title: It's Blitz!
label: Interscope
description: YYYs make the dreaded "mature album" work by taking familiar shapes and tools and recombining them in ways that are bracing and unexpected.

title: Mt. St. Helens Vietnam Band
label: Dead Oceans
description: MSHVB sound like a bunch of talented, precocious kids let loose for an afternoon in a studio and given until the end of the day to devise a grand statement.

title: The Invisible Lodger
label: Fire
description: Yes! A new Various Production record! And... it's a collaboration with Scottish poet Gerry Mitchell. Hmm.

title: Caught in the Trees
label: Secretly Canadian
description: The veteran singer-songwriter treads familiar thematic territory with a tight backing band and a renewed sense of cheer.

title: Slow Dance
label: K
description: Billed as winter-themed, Slow Dance uses crisp garage-rock and frigid post-punk as a backdrop for romanticized pop fantasy.

title: Junior
label: Astralwerks
description: Röyksopp's third album finds them synthesizing the highs and lows from their previous records to strike a knowing middle ground. Robyn and Lykke Li guest.

title: Elvis Perkins in Dearland
label: XL
description: On his second album, 4AD troubadour formally introduces his three-piece touring band, proving himself a charismatic bandleader in the process.

title: Money
label: Tomlab
description: Out-funk band's first album for Tomlab and fifth overall presents it as aggressive lurkers pumping out distended sex jams.

title: Havilah
label: ATP
description: Well known in Australia, this high-velocity garage-blues act is still all-too-overlooked elsewhere.

title: Early Output: 1996-1998
label: Temporary Residence
description: The post-rock band that included Four Tet and Adem collects its initial releases, plus unreleased tracks.

title: Grace/Wastelands
label: Parlophone
description: Ex-Libertine enlists Graham Coxon and Stephen Street, but the story here is still his self-aware yet not terribly insightful approach to his own sobriety.

title: Advance Base Battery Life
label: Tomlab
description: Just a month before his latest record of new songs, Casiotone offers this collection of singles and rarities.

title: White Bird Release
label: Kranky
description: The latest solo project from Labradord's Mark Nelson is proof of how ambient music can benefit from a songwriter's disciplined ear and instinct for concision.

title: Static Tensions
label: Prosthetic
description: Like fellow Georgians Mastodon and Baroness, Kylesa have brilliantly alloyed sludge metal with melody and finesse.

title: The Proper Sex
label: Social Registry
description: The Proper Sex is the debut full-length from I.U.D., a duo of Lizzi Bougatsos of Gang Gang Dance and Sadie Laska from Growing.

title: The Hazards of Love
label: Capitol
description: Always defined by their eccentricities, the Decemberists offer a tangled narrative set to thick stoner-metal sludge and prog-folk arpeggios.

title: Lamb's Anger
label: Ed Banger
description: Ten years after Levi's and Flat Eric, Mr. Oizo issues his latest via French touch linchpin Ed Banger Records.

title: Pierced
label: Naxos
description: Bang on a Can co-leader makes a refreshing and rare foray into solo territory.

title: Born Radical
label: Gangplank
description: Ryan Allen of Thunderbirds Are Now! returns with a vigorously played song cycle about the life of a rock journeyman.

title: The Floodlight Collective
label: Kranky
description: Deerhunter guitarist makes his solo debut, a hazy bedroom reverie that shouldn't surprise listeners accustomed to his main band. Bradford Cox guests.

title: Fever Ray
label: Mute
description: Three years after the landmark Silent Shout, the Knife's Karin Dreijer Andersson returns as Fever Ray. Fans of the Knife will not be disappointed.

title: White Light Strobing
label: K
description: Pacific NW band crafts word-shy, languid dream-pop in the style of Galaxie 500, heavy on atmosphere and gently cascading guitars.

title: Fabric 45
label: Fabric
description: Fabric's latest was created by an up-and-coming Detroit techno producer, but not one genuflecting before his city's rich dance history.

title: Calypsoul 70: Caribbean Soul & Calypso Crossover 1969-1979
label: Strut
description: Calypsoul 70 reflects the incredible melting pot of the Caribbean by collecting tracks recorded in the funky 70s from throughout the region.

title: Take My Breath Away
label: Kompakt
description: Brazilian producer's follow-up to 2007's excellent Chromophobia is another fusion of rock dynamics, synth-pop textures, and techno propulsion.

title: Enemy Mine
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Second album from the indie rock supergroup comprised of Dan Bejar, Spencer Krug, and Carey Mercer is more balanced and inclusive than its predecessor.

title: The Wolf Also Shall Dwell With the Lamb
label: Important
description: James Blackshaw, today's foremost guitarist in the modern primitive tradition, teams with lutist Jozef van Wissem. Insert RenFair joke here.

title: L'Entredeux
label: self-released
description: French-born, Arizona-based, this singer-filmmaker keeps listeners at a safe distance even as her low, smoky chanteuse vocals draw them closer.

title: Flood Bank
label: Acute
description: The EPs and singles by this sadly unheralded post-punk group finally saw the light of day on Memory Span; here their LPs are collected as well.

title: Quiet Please...The New Best of Nick Lowe
label: Yep Roc
description: Not to be confused with the 1989 best-of Basher, this new comp presents a fuller view of the diverse singer-songwriter's career.

title: Bromst
label: Carpark
description: After breakthough Spiderman of the Rings, Dan Deacon returns with another great record whose palette is richer, the samples smoother, the space larger.

title: All Aboard Future
label: Dead Oceans
description: If the Yeah Yeah Yeahs had pursued the more confrontational branches of New York no-wave, they would probably sound like this.

title: Beasts of Seasons
label: Hush
description: The Pac NW coughs up folksy, understated singer-songwriters by the coffeehouseful, but this Portland-based singer shouldn't become lost in that crowd.

title: Heavy Ghost
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: A designer by trade, this My Brightest Diamond protégé is proving himself an adept songwriter as well.

title: The Tiffany Transcriptions
artist: Bob Wills and His Texas Playboys
label: Collector's Choice
description: Texas swing at its rowdiest and most anarchic, corralling jazz, blues, swing, jug band, and Zydeco stomps and reels into a distinctly American sound.

title: Fist of God
label: Dim Mak
description: Latest from half of the sadly departed DFA79 always seems to be shouting over itself, a tone that accounts for its virtues and shortcomings alike.

title: Baby, They Told Us We Would Rise Again
label: SCI Fidelity
description: Recent Drive-By Truckers openers issues their eighth album in 23 years of hauling ass around the country, playing to every kind of crowd.

title: To Lose My Life...
label: Fiction
description: Lots of bands emulate bits of Joy Division. Sometimes they're Radiohead, sometimes they're Interpol, and, alas, sometimes they're White Lies.

title: Coward
label: Cryptogramophone
description: Spinning through delicate acoustics, genre homages, abstract meditations, and electro-funk, Wilco guitarist Nels Cline offers an eclectic new LP.

title: I Blame You
label: Sub Pop
description: Former Drive Like Jehu and Hot Snakes singer/guitarist Rick Froberg unveils his new Sub Pop project.

title: Why There Are Mountains
label: self-released
description: Plucking influences from 90s indie rock isn't new, but Cymbals Eat Guitars perfectly embody that casually ambitious slack-rock sound. Sometimes you just want the basics.

title: The Otha Side of the Trap...
label: Asylum
description: While Gucci Mane cooled in a cell, his protégé OJ Da Juiceman kicked his promo game into high gear.

title: Love's Recurring Dream
label: Italic
description: The new one from Coloma sounds a great deal like Rufus Wainwright if he spent more time paying tribute to Leonard Cohen than Judy Garland.

title: Birdseed Shirt
label: What Delicate
description: Ferocious and brave, this debut LP is a well-balanced demonstration of both thoughtful existentialism and strange, drowsy downers.

title: Troubadour
label: A&M
description: Somali-born MC is positing himself as an antidote to what he considers conscience-less, spoiled, insular mainstream rap.

title: Grrr...
label: Dead Oceans
description: Bishop Allen's 2006 monthly EP series suggested a band of educated romantics. Here they aim to replicate that on their new LP.

title: Reincarnations: The Remix Chapter 2001-2009
label: Get Physical
description: Like Battles' Mirrored, this Kompakt remix album delights in the goofy-unto-surreal things electronics can do to the human voice.

title: Angst Is Not a Weltanschauung!
label: Morr
description: Even while recording in the wake of a friend's death, this Morr mainstay's complex, nuanced tunes don't lose their subtle uplift.

title: Kaleidoscopic
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: The leader of underrated post-rock combo Jaga Jazzist follows Joanna Newsom or Robert Wyatt by occupying the ambiguous region between classical music and pop.

title: Just Like Heaven: A Tribute to the Cure / Perfect as Cats: A Tribute to the Cure
label: Manimal Vinyl
description: Did you want three discs' worth of Cure tribute material? Too late.

title: Face Control
label: Sub Pop
description: On every conceivable level-- even down to the cover art-- the new LP from Wolf Parade-related Handsome Furs bests its predecessor.

title: Drone Trailer
label: Dicristina
description: Matthew Valentine, who rose to a kind of freak-folk prominence as Tower Recordings, returns with partner Erika Elder.

title: Communion
label: Yep Roc
description: Sweden's unabashed retro rockers release a 24-song 2xCD album. Seriously, 24 songs.

title: The B.C. Era
label: self-released
description: Southern rapper loosely affiliated with Eminem and Dre has to release his music for free online.

title: As Seen Through Windows
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Arcade Fire-related band enlists Tortoise's John McEntire and expands its cinematic scope and orchestration.

title: Fuckbook
label: Matador
description: Despite outward appearances, this is the new covers record from indie rock legends Yo La Tengo.

title: Assemble
label: Joyful Noise
description: Disjointed guitar rhythms, unpredictable drumbeats, and strained soprano vocals make unavoidable the comparison to Deerhoof.

title: Thank You Very Quickly
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Thrill Jockey releases another seamless blend of American rock music with benga, Kenya's ebullient and propulsive dance music.

title: The Art of Field Recording, Vol. 2
label: Dust-to-Digital
description: Atlanta's Dust-to-Digital releases another sweeping, vital 4xCD collection of field recordings.

title: (a)spera
label: K
description: Latest from Pac NW singer-songwriter is marked by lush sound and diverse instrumentation.

title: Little Hells
label: Kemado
description: Marissa Nadler's elegant new album is also her most expansive, with production that sharpens old strengths while exposing new ones.

title: Song of the Pearl
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Thrill Jockey's Arbouretum tone down both guitar heroics and song lengths while honing lyrics and song structures.

title: FabricLive 43
label: Fabric
description: UK producer/DJ mixes French techno with Baltimore club and anything in between.

title: Francophonic, Vol. 1: 1953 - 1980
artist: Franco & le Tout Puissant OK Jazz
label: Sterns Africa
description: This innovative bandleader refocused trends and built entirely new genres in his native Congo.

title: The Truth Is Here
label: Rhymesayers
description: Collecting B-sides and outtakes along with new material, this EP finds rapper Brother Ali mixing political commentary and shit-talking.

title: Mama, I'm Swollen
label: Saddle Creek
description: After another three-year break, Cursive return with a straight shot of melodramatic misery and despair, leavening the shouty intensity with orchestration.

title: Ye Viols!
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Jan St. Werner of Mouse on Mars compiles recent works commissioned to accompany art installations.

title: May a Lightning Bolt Caress You EP
label: self-released
description: Chicago-based organ/percussion two-piece combines punky energy with the music of Eastern Europe. Dave Sitek produces.

title: Carboniferous
label: Ipecac
description: Mike Patton recruits Italy's most progressive no-wave metal bands (as far as we know) to his eclectic Ipecac roster.

title: Money Will Ruin Everything: The Second Edition
label: Rune Grammofon
description: This outstanding experimental Norweigian label celebrates its 10th anniversary with a 2xCD + book collection.

title: Beat Konducta Vol. 5-6
label: Stones Throw
description: Madlib pays tribute to the late J Dilla, a producer with whom he created the classic Champion Sound.

title: Songbook
label: End of the Road
description: Hushed folk-pop with orchestral flourishes and the occasional whimsically long song title mark this Calgary band's debut.

title: Selected + Collected: An eMusic Selects Compilation
label: eMusic
description: The online retailer gathers the best of their Selects choices into a handy CD-sized collection.

title: Glider
label: Ghostly
description: Seattle artist inverts the minimal techno aesthetic of Gas-- burying the thump and emphasizing the ambience.

title: The Law of the Playground
description: English band follows The Best Party Ever with more sunny harmonies and anorak pop.

title: Frontier
label: Manimal Vinyl
description: Part cosmic fun house, part haunted house, Danielle Stech-Homsy's sophomore release began as a series of poems.

title: All Y'All
label: My Anxious Mouth
description: Atlanta band-- working here with Animal Collective producer Ben Allen-- crafts its own version of British Invasion rock.

title: Surf City EP
label: Morr
description: A New Zealand band paying tribute to Kiwi bands of the past, Surf City are a glorious throwback with a sense of purpose.

title: Black Moses / Juicy Fruit (Disco Freak)
label: Stax
description: Two reissues-- one that finds Hayes at his orchestral soul peak and a lesser-known disco excursion.

title: SpaceShipp
label: Treader
description: Their third collaboration, SpaceShipp again pairs the Spiritualized leader with experimental pianist Matthew Shipp.

title: Wavvves
label: Fat Possum
description: One-man noise-pop project Nathan Williams delivers on his first widely released LP.

title: Secrets Are Sinister
label: Original Signal
description: New York band's latest again infuses turn-of-the-millennium Strokes moves with more bombastic stadium rock.

title: The Good Feeling Music of Dent May and His Magnificent Ukulele
label: Paw Tracks
description: Mississippi native's debut on Animal Collective's Paw Tracks imprint finds him working in the realm of schmaltzy barroom pop with a style that's sometimes evocative of Jens Lekman or Stephin Merritt.

title: Shrag
label: Where It's At Is Where You Are
description: Brighton, UK's Shrag are a sharp, up-and-coming poppy post-punk band smearing their own dark lip gloss on sex and gender while also looking for real, vital connection.

title: Reviver EP
label: Post Present Medium
description: On their debut, L.A.'s Abe Vigoda made self-described "tropical punk," mixing steel drum-mimicking guitars and stilted, hard-to-play rhythms; on this new EP, the band takes the next logical step in the development of their easy-to-peg sound: they abandon it.

title: Middle Cyclone
label: Anti-
description: Middle Cyclone

title: The Bridge: Concept of a Culture
label: Strut
description: The musical legend and hip-hop pioneer-- who has spent the past few decades DJing-- issues his first record of new beats since the Reagan administration. An all-star role call of guests make appearances, including Q-Tip, KRS-One, Big Daddy Kane, and Snoop Dogg.

title: My DNA
label: Retard Disco
description: Bis keyboardist and singer's first solo album finds her still experimenting with variations on the bright, kandy pop of her former band.

title: Here We Go Magic
label: Western Vinyl
description: Luke Temple's new project finds him letting his psychedelic impulses take over, as he adds hazy electronic textures, loops, and extended bits of ambience and noise.

title: Labyrinthes
label: Dare to Care
description: Montreal band follows its breakout sophomore album, Trompe-l'Oeil, by amping up the prog with multipart mini-epics and jarring structural changes.

title: No Line on the Horizon
label: Interscope
description: No Line on the Horizon

title: Holler and Stomp
label: Transdreamer
description: Denver-based Elephant 6 OGs are still chugging along, their power-pop tendencies now mixed with a bit of alt-rock grit.

title: Haven't Slept All Year
label: Scat
description: Haven't Slept All Year

title: Tchamantché
label: Nonesuch
description: Tchamantché

title: War Child Presents Heroes
label: Astralwerks
description: War Child Presents Heroes

title: Super Roots 10
label: Avex Trax
description: Super Roots 10

title: Two Nice Catholic Boys
label: Family Vineyard
description: Recorded during the 1997 Euro tour that birthed In Bern, this is the second collaboration between these two avant heroes.

title: The Blue Depths
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Jagjaguwar band leaves behind most of its melodramatic art-rock moves, showing a newfound restraint and a rich and sumptuous sound.

title: I Want to Go Where Things Are Beautiful
label: Twos & Fews
description: I Want to Go Where Things Are Beautiful

title: To Be Still
label: Rough Trade
description: To Be Still

title: Dark Was the Night
label: 4AD
description: Red Hot comp features Arcade Fire, Spoon, Feist, Decemberists, Cat Power, Antony, Bon Iver, members of Sigur Rós, and many others.

title: Recovery
label: Fractured
description: Recovery is a 7" box set (10 singles, 20 tracks) put out by the Fractured label; the imprint asked 20 artists working in the realm of experimental music to cover a song, and the results include Matmos doing Bow Wow Wow, Jóhann Jóhannsson on OMD, Barbara Mortgenstern tackling New Order, and Fennesz covering A-Ha.

title: Fabric 42
label: Fabric
description: The German duo behind "Rej" and other recent 12" wonders offers the famed Fabric mix series a combination of viscous minimal techno and rigorous tech-house.

title: Choral
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Brooklyn-based drone duo offers up their most coherent album yet, balancing organic instrumentation with percolating electronic undercurrents.

title: An Imaginary Country
label: Kranky
description: An Imaginary Country

title: Invaders Must Die
label: Take Me to the Hospital
description: Invaders Must Die

title: Jean on Jean
label: Kanine
description: Former Out Hud cellist Molly Schnick drops almost everything about her former band on this new project, a collection of strummy bedroom chamber-pop.

title: Recordings 1969-1988
label: Faitiche
description: The first release on experimental electronic producer Jan Jelinek's label Faitiche, the homemade recordings of the late Ursula Bogner might never have been heard outside her immediate family had Jelinek not discovered them, or recorded them and conceived the entire backstory himself, depending on who you ask.

title: U
label: Room40
description: Japanese singer and experimentalist releases her second album for the Australian Room40 label, collaborating with its founder English and associate Chantler, who help her expertly bridge obtuse style and a pleasing sound.

title: Hungry Bird
description: Originally slated as the final album from Eef Barzelay's Clem Snide, which may or may not be defunct, Hungry Bird substitutes the band's erstwhile lighthearted alt-country with more sober, standard folk fare.

title: The Century of Self
artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
label: Richter Scale
description: The Century of Self

title: How Will You?
label: Drag City
description: On her third Drag City solo album, Azita scraps most of her Steely Dan-like tendencies for a more traditional (if subtly unnerving) take on cabaret-pop.

title: Feel. Love. Thinking. Of.
label: Friendly Fire
description: On their second album, these former slow-motion shoegazers are reborn as purveyors of luminous and deeply affecting electronic pop.

title: The Mountain
label: Fat Possum
description: With Spoon producer Mike McCarthy behind the boards, this blues-rock band from Dayton, Ohio, aims for a slightly cleaner sound to accompany songs that are a touch more introspective.

title: The Ultimate Peter Tosh Experience
label: Schanachie
description: With two DVDs alongside an oddly selected 14-track audio disc, The Ultimate Peter Tosh Experience isn't exactly what is claims to be.**

title: 200 Million Thousand
label: Vice
description: 200 Million Thousand

title: Wrecking Ball
label: Razor & Tie
description: Georgia band purees alt-country tropes together with the muddy crash of grunge on their debut full-length.

title: I Don't Know Where I'm Going But I'm on My Way
label: Humminbird
description: The Old 97s bass player releases his solo debut, a collection of originals and mostly covers that employ trains as vehicles for a spiritual journey and that sounds more musically adventurous than anything his band has done.

title: Astral Weeks Live at the Hollywood Bowl
label: Manhattan
description: One of rock's most legendary cult records, Astral Weeks has now inspired a series of concerts and an inevitable live document honoring those shows.

title: God Loves Ugly
label: Rhymesayers
description: God Loves Ugly

title: March of the Zapotec / Holland
label: Pompeii
description: Zach Condon continues to surprise if not amaze on this intriguing and disparate 2xEP.

title: Exodus
label: Expansion Team
description: This debut album by filmmaker and media production head Alex Moulton scores an imagined science-fiction adventure with classic Vangelis and French House flourishes.

title: Davy
label: Young Baby
description: Actor Jason Schwartzman-- who, to be fair, was making music before he was making movies-- returns with another rewarding small-scale pop project, reminiscent of 60s British Invasion artists and 90s artists like Elliott Smith and Weezer who aped them.

title: Cinematic Shades (The Slow Songs)
label: Get Physical
description: Get Physical stars return with a digital-only compilation of reworked and formerly issued material.

title: Extra Cheese EP
label: Lost Highway
description: Extra Cheese EP

title: Incredibad
label: Interscope
description: Incredibad

title: sBach
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Spencer Seim, guitarist for Hella and drummer for the Advantage, here takes multi-instrumentalism to its logical conclusion, playing every instrument on this Suicide Squeeze release.

title: ...For the Whole World to See
label: Drag City
description: ...For the Whole World to See

title: Studio 1
label: Studio
description: A collection of early techno tracks by German scenemaker and Kompakt co-owner Wolfgang Voigt (aka Gas) marks an embrace of formalism as a way toward something new.

title: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit
label: Lightning Rod
description: On his second solo album, the former Drive-By Truckers member sticks with what he does best, offering detailed and evocative songwriting in a bar-band setting.

title: The Spirit of Apollo
label: Anti-
description: The Spirit of Apollo

title: Emerald Eyes
label: self-released
description: This placid and peaceful Texas-based duo favors molasses-slow keyboard drones and heavily reverbed vocals, sometimes evoking the dreaminess and eerie ambience of Beach House or Julee Cruise.

title: Black Forest (Tra La La)
label: Science of Sound
description: Stripping down orchestral pop to something acoustic and approachable-- much like fellow Wisconsinites Violent Femmes did with punk a quarter-century ago-- Pale Young Gentlemen make nice strides on their second album.

title: Tight Knit
label: Sub Pop
description: The fourth album (first for Sub Pop) from this folk-rock/cosmic country band is built with a keen ear for detail, be it a subtle dose of pedal steel or a gently rippling guitar effect, and it features leader Andy Cabic's most consistently engaging batch of songs to date.

title: Hush
label: Polyvinyl
description: Now a duo of Yuki Chikudate and James Hanna, Asobi Seksu return with a third album that takes the dreamy shoegaze palette of 2006's Citrus into a quieter and and more reserved place.

title: Hold Time
label: Merge
description: Hold Time

title: Anthology 1997-98
label: Dischord
description: This collection gathers stray tracks and singles from the short-lived and underrated D.C. band on Dischord that grew out of Smart Went Crazy.

title: Recitement
label: Allegro Music
description: The versatile Dutch composer Stephen Emmer, with production from Tony Visconti, combines music and spoken literary texts, with readers like Lou Reed, Allen Ginsberg, and Jorge Luis Borges tackling words by Yoko Ono, Paul Theroux, Samuel Beckett, and more.

title: The Bright Orange Years / All-Night Lotus Party
label: Homestead
description: The Bright Orange Years / All-Night Lotus Party

title: Goodnight Oslo
label: Yep Roc
description: Iconoclast and leader of both the Soft Boys and his Egyptians, Robyn Hitchock again teams with R.E.M.'s Peter Buck and well-known utility player Scott McCaughey on his latest solo record. As usual, echoes of Syd Barrett, the Beatles, and Television Personalities are heard frequently.

title: Paul’s Boutique
label: Capitol
description: The Beastie Boys' landmark second album is remastered and reissued 20 years on.

title: In the House of Mirrors
label: Crammed Discs
description: The late cross-cultural composer Hector Zazou's final work fuses Indian and Uzbek musicians for a modern update of traditional Indian music.

title: Interoceans
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Beginning with a bedrock of improvisation, California duo I Heart Lung transform their spontaneous creations into lengthy composed pieces layered with multiple instruments and sound effects. Nels Cline guests.

title: Coastlines
label: Internasjonal
description: After remixes for kindred sprits like Low Motion Disco and the Tough Alliance, San Francisco duo Windsurf bring their brand of clean and chilled-out beachside music to Prins Thomas' Internasjonal label.

title: Major General
label: Fistolo
description: The Hold Steady keyboardist and member of the World/Inferno Friendship Society packs a lifetime of ideas into his solo debut, touching on mid-1990s alt-rock, tipsy Billy Joel balladry, Sunday afternoon swing, and Eastern European folk-tinged rave-ups.

title: Keep It Hid
label: Nonesuch
description: Keep It Hid

title: All of Us In Our Night
label: Self
description: Athens, Ga., power-poppers follow up 2005's tuneful Catalogue of Generous Men with an album noticeably darker and less immediately accessible than their debut.

title: The Singles
label: Rong
description: This Brooklyn duo-- which counts !!! singer/ drummer John Pugh as one of its members-- hit and miss on this collection of their six singles.

title: Dissolver
label: Narnack
description: After two arcane, challenging, and beautiful albums released in the beginning of the decade, this San Francisco trio reveled in their enigma status for years. Now they're back with the cleaner, leaner Dissolver. TV on the Radio's Kyp Malone and Dave Sitek help out.

title: Odessa
label: Polydor
description: Rhino's 3xCD reissue of the Bee Gees' ornate and ambitious 1969 album includes mono and stereo mixes and an extra disc of demos and previously unreleased tracks.

title: It's Not Me, It's You
label: Capitol
description: It's Not Me, It's You

title: Come With Me If You Want to Live
label: Robcore
description: Pinback's Rob Crow is still pressing on with his lovingly silly metal side project; it's now moved beyond the novelty stage-- as the improved songwriting shows.

title: 7 Trx + Intermission
label: Information
description: One half of Balearic revivalists Studio, D. Lissvik dismissed his group's synths and vocals here to focus primarily on the electric guitar.

title: Come Back to the Five and Dime, Bobby Dee Bobby Dee
label: Domino
description: Singer-songwriter's second album veers from doo-wop and folk to Queen bombast to tell the story of the tragic life and lonely death of Disney child actor Bobby Driscoll.

title: To Willie
label: Dead Oceans
description: Matthew Houck, aka Phosphorescent, follows three fine LPs of original songs with a tribute to the Red Headed Stranger, Willie Nelson.

title: Factory Records: Communications 1978-92
label: Rhino
description: This 4xCD box set covering 15 years of music from Manchester's legendary Factory imprint-- Joy Division, New Order, OMD, A Certain Ratio, Happy Mondays, and many more are represented-- has the difficult task of summarizing a famously wayward label.

title: In the City
label: Cash Money
description: Ca$h Money release a rock album; not surprisingly it sounds like N.E.R.D. or a body spray commercial. Nas, Rick Ross, and Lil Wayne guest.

title: Yes, I Smoke Crack EP / Water EP
label: Merok
description: Yes, I Smoke Crack EP / Water EP

title: Pantheon of the Lesser
label: Important
description: This monolithic sophomore album from Portland, Maine's long-and-heavy metal quartet Ocean-- two tracks, almost 60 minutes-- is like an act of defiance to this speeding, shrinking world.

title: Patches
label: Unsuitable
description: DJ/Rupture's first release on his new label, Unsuitable, is a collabaration with the Ex guitarist Andy Moor. Consisting of live, improvised tracks the duo recorded while touring together, the often-delirious concoction is almost the opposite of Rupture's 2008 mix Uproot-- guitar-centric, spontaneous, and brittle.

title: Afro Samurai Resurrection
label: Wu Music Group
description: The follow-up to 2007's manga soundtrack Afro Samurai, Resurrection finds RZA working with many of his Wu-Tang cohorts.

title: Mirror Eye
label: Social Registry
description: Contemporaries of Gang Gang Dance and Black Dice, NYC's Psychic Ills here fully indulge their abstract tendencies, eschewing all traditional means of songcraft for a record that is almost wholly improvised.

title: Month of Madness
label: self-released
description: Philly rapper compiles 32 well-written, expertly produced tracks-- released once per day for the month of December-- into the overlooked Month of Madness mixtape*.*

title: Volume One: The Vodoun Effect (Funk & Sato from Benin's Obscure Labels 1973-1975)
label: Analog Africa
description: One of the most prolific and underappreciated bands of the 20th century-- Benin's Orchestre Poly-Rythmo-- finally gets its due.

title: The Crawling Distance
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: Robert Pollard and Todd Tobias continue a working relationship that has enjoyed its share of recent successes, most notably 2006's From a Compound Eye and last year's Robert Pollard Is Off to Business.

title: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
label: Slumberland
description: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart

title: Changing Horses
label: ATO
description: As the title suggests, here Ben Kweller jumps from making polite, mannered 1960s-influenced indie-pop to polite, mannered 1970s influenced alt-country.

title: Love, Hate, and Then There's You
label: Majordomo
description: Five long years on from Pawn Shoppe Heart and their alt-rock moment, the Von Bondies reemerge with a stern-faced intent and self-belief that sounds more like the Killers than their former friends and contemporaries the White Stripes.

title: Leave It All Behind
label: Nicolay Music
description: North Carolina MC Phonte and Dutch producer Nicolay continue their partnership with an unexpected left-turn, crafting a surprisingly strong full-on R&B record with almost no rapping.

title: The Memorial Collection / Down the Line: Rarities
label: Geffen
description: The Memorial Collection / Down the Line: Rarities

title: Live Session EP
label: iTunes
description: Like the recent iTunes My Morning Jacket EP, this exclusive Deerhoof EP features the band recorded live, inside a studio. Mostly drawn from last year's Offend Maggie, the six-song set does feature one new song.

title: Devastator
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Chicago-based bar band on Secretly Canadian adds some additional instrumentation on their second full length, but still lives and dies on the strength of lead singer George Hunter's voice.

title: Civil War
label: Fat Wreck Chords
description: Minneapolis pop-punk band returns with its first studio album since 2002, a politically-focused record that shades typically rowdy moments with a newfound maturity.

title: RTZ
label: Drag City
description: Ben Chasny illuminates the more neglected corners of his dense discography on the 2xCD/triple-vinyl set RTZ, which takes from split 12" releases, subscription-only CDs, and Chasny's personal tape stash, plus a reissue of 1999's Nightly Trembling album, whose original release (as legend has it) was limited to 33 copies.

title: Never Better
label: Rhymesayers
description: Fusing hip-hop and punk, the third solo record from this Minneapolis-based rapper and member of the Doomtree collective is his tightest album yet.

title: The Time of the Assassins
label: Ryko
description: Strokes bassist Nikolai Fraiture is the latest member of the band to start a side project. Regina Spektor and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs' Nick Zinner guest.

title: Clomeim
label: Locust
description: Veterans of the tape-trading and micro-label cultures, No Neck Blues Band have been releasing music for more than a decade but this is oddly only their fourth proper studio album-- and it finds the band touching on metal's sonic heft and under-surface collision.

title: Eine Kleine Nacht Musik
label: Modular
description: British producer Henry Smithson, best known for working as Riton, adopts a new moniker and crafts a loving homage to krautrock.

title: The Singles, Vol. 6: 1969-1970
label: Hip-O Select
description: The latest in this Hip-O series finds James Brown in transition and caught in many minds, recording essential sides even when he made off-the-wall choices.

title: Decent Work for Decent Pay
label: Big Dada
description: This selection of Diplo's remix work-- including refits of tracks by Daft Punk, M.I.A., and Bloc Party-- highlighs a bunch of songs you likely have on MP3 or a mixtape, plus a surprisingly deft selection of instrumental work.

title: Years of Refusal
label: Lost Highway
description: Morrissey and his Tormentors continue their 21st century winning streak with a record that, while offering no new twists or surprises, finds the former Smiths co-leader in strong voice-- both as a singer and songwriter.

title: Parplar
label: Young God
description: Latest from this eccentric sing-songwriter on Michael Gira's Young God label can be wondrous and wildly inventive as well as self-indulgent.

title: Immolate Yourself
label: Bpitch Control
description: Telefon Tel Aviv's latest-- released on the heels of the death of bandmember Charles Cooper-- is a detailed and smartly programmed reimagining of 1980s synth-pop.

title: Paranoid Cocoon
label: Suicide Squeeze
description: Michael Nau, ex-Page France leader, releases the first LP from his new project. The countrified atmosphere and vocal trade-offs with Whitney McGraw fall somewhere between Johnny Cash and June Carter and Yo La Tengo circa *And Then Nothing Turned Itself Inside-Out.*

title: Boombox
label: Parlophone
description: Kylie Minogue's 2000s resurrection as an electro-pop superstar is celebrated on this remix collection, which includes reworkings of her songs from artists such as the Chemical Brothers and Fischerspooner.

title: I Think We're Gonna Need a Bigger Boat
label: Southern Fried
description: Norman Cook, aka Fatboy Slim, returns as the central figure of the BPA, or Brighton Port Authority-- a catchall for stuff Cook does with various vocalists, including David Byrne, Iggy Pop, and Dizzee Rascal.

title: Ray Guns Are Not Just the Future
label: Blue Note
description: The second album from L.A. scenesters the Bird and the Bee sticks close to their original template, with more cool electro-exotica flecked with global pop touches.

title: Sparklace
label: Polyvinyl
description: Drummer from Aloha and White Williams releases his second solo offering, a departure from his brainy, ambient 2006 debut Illuminated Manuscript, that augments his cerebral beats with charming melodies and glassy, glammy grooves of his day-job bands.

title: You and I
label: Frenchkiss
description: After moving to London, abandoning their hardcore roots, and hooking up with ex-Suede guitarist Bernard Butler as producer, this spirited, young New Zealand rock band is finally ready for its close-up.

title: A.M.
label: Friend or Faux
description: Swervedriver's Adam Franklin and Interpol's Sam Fogarino re-connect after a lackluster EP and give themselves room to make a case as more than just another side project.

title: Stay Awake EP
label: Matador
description: Neither a coda nor a collection of cast-offs or curios, this five-song EP lays out five fresh new cuts worthy of any Times New Viking LP. And, hell, you can even pick out a lyric or two.

title: Take Me to the Sea
label: Matador
description: Take Me to the Sea

title: Dream Island Laughing Language
label: Marriage
description: Los Angeles-based duo, whose conceptual work is often discussed in the context of Animal Collective, release a sketchbook of their diverse musical influences that throws a lot of stuff at the wall; it's remarkable how much of it sticks.

title: Dear John
label: Polyvinyl
description: On his new album, indie-twee songwriter Loney Dear taps a surprising a vein of melancholy...and it suits him.

title: Sur La Bouche: Live in Montreal 1993
label: Merge
description: The fourth release in Superchunk's live, limited-edition Clambake series, Sur La Bouche: Live in Montreal 1993 finds the band endearingly devoid of bullshit and devoted to writing songs powered by things often, oddly missing from today's indie rock: energy and volume.

title: Mx6: Twitch's 60 Minutes of Fear / Sleepwalk
label: Rvng Intl.
description: Mx6: Twitch's 60 Minutes of Fear / Sleepwalk

title: How Little Will It Take
label: Load
description: Collecting an out-of-print LP with live tracks and compilation appearances, How Little Will It Take makes a convincing case that Providence's Landed were the proper heirs to the Jesus Lizard's noise-rock throne.

title: Traitors
label: Relapse
description: Misery Index's latest album wraps the band's precise, melodic blend of death metal and grindcore around a progressive political message.

title: Deep Gems
label: Italians Do It Better
description: A "singles, B-sides, and rarities" disc, the latest from Italians Do It Better linchpin Glass Candy suggests that not every band needs an odds'n'sods collection-- at least not this early into its career.

title: Skin of Evil
label: Soft Abuse
description: As Blackout Beach, Carey Mercer (Frog Eyes, Swan Lake) retains his careful attention to scope and language but here stays on task and creates something gloriously claustrophobic and engaging from start to finish.

title: Hot Chip with Robert Wyatt and Geese
label: EMI
description: Hot Chip draft avant-music elder statesman Robert Wyatt-- and Geese; don't forget Geese-- to re-imagine a quartet of their own songs, giving the band cultural capital by working with a legend, while Wyatt himself gains a dose of youthful energy.

title: Flower of Evil
label: Rune Grammofon
description: Susanna (sans her Magical Orchestra) tackles another slate of cover songs comprising unlikely selections from Tom Petty, Thin Lizzy, ABBA, and more. Will Oldham duets on several tracks, including a version of his Bonnie "Prince" Billy song "Joy and Jubilee".

title: The Thrush
label: Obey Your Brain
description: Members of stalwart Chicago acts like Mahjongg, Icy Demons, and Mucca Pazza come together to create mostly instrumental Moog-laden space-funk.

title: Artifacts
label: Exponential
description: Bringing back the blunted mid-1990s aesthetic of labels like Mo' Wax, San Antonio producer Aether also exhibits a flair for economy on this smartly paced and and quickly shifting exercise in mood alteration.

title: Gutter Tactics
label: Ipecac
description: Ipecac indie hip-hop group return with another set of verbal bluntness and sonic brutality, helping to color the fringes of rap with musical and political gusto.

title: Working on a Dream
label: Columbia
description: Bruce Springsteen's work this decade first played up to listeners' notions of post-9/11 recovery, then conjured up bleak visions of Bush-era America; here the Boss settles into some sense of contentment on Working on a Dream, as if that Dream had already been achieved.

title: Dragon Chinese Cocktail Horoscope
label: SideCho
description: Singer-songwriter's fourth album, again co-produced with Scott Solter, finds him paring back his sound and opting for a markedly darker feel.

title: Oh, the Places We'll Go
label: K
description: Twee-ish band on K consists of pop dreamers of an unusually levelheaded kind, while their music moves between between faster-paced glee-club soul and trippier, jazzier reveries.

title: Johnson&Jonson
label: Tres
description: Mixing invocations of youthful indiscretion and coming-of-age epiphanies, Los Angeles rapper Blu and producer Mainframe create one of the best and most underrated underground hip-hop records of the past six months.

title: Jon Brion Remix EP / Synecdoche, New York OST
label: Polyvinyl
description: Jon Brion Remix EP / Synecdoche, New York OST

title: Tonight
label: Domino
description: After a few years of non-stop activity that found them moving from clubs to a Mercury Prize win and Grammy performance, Franz Ferdinand took time off and have re-emerged with an album that, more so than stoking current commerical prospects, is an exciting look at the band's potential future.

title: Swimmer
label: Partisan
description: Portland, Ore.'s the Standard go the self-released route on Swimmer, trying to find a way to make wide-screen atmospheric rock on an independent budget.

title: An Invitation
label: Everloving
description: The Bird and the Bee singer teams with baroque-pop hero, family friend, and recent Joanna Newsom and Rufus Wainwright collaborator Van Dyke Parks on a record inspired by Edith Piaf.

title: Silent City
label: World Village
description: Brooklyn string quartet in the mold of the Kronos and Balanescu joins Kurdish Iranian virtuoso Kayhan Kalhor for an album that finds common ground between Persian folk and modern minimalism.

title: Vacilando Territory Blues
label: Western Vinyl
description: A solo artist for nearly five years, Fleet Foxes drummer and vocalist J. Tillman releases his first record since joining the suddenly successful Americana band.

title: The Eraser Rmxs
label: XL
description: Originally sold as MP3s, then a collection of three-song EPs, then as a CD in Japan last year, this collection of Thom Yorke remixes-- from such electronic all-stars as Burial, Four Tet, the Field, the Bug, and Various-- finally gets a U.S. full-length release.

title: Night Shot
label: Kindercore
description: Debut from electropop outfit that includes Dan Geller (formerly of I Am the World Trade Center) finds room for a cover of Peter Gabriel's "Solsbury Hill" and a guest spot from Tay "Chocolate Rain" Zonday.

title: Hold This Ghost
label: Frog Stand
description: Band from Portland, Ore., dreams in sepia tones, combining acoustic guitar, singing saw, accordion, and organ to evoke an antique setting befitting their haunted songs.

title: Luniculaire EP
label: Dead Oceans
description: Casey Dienel's five-song exploration of her own Francophilia featurs three covers (of Serge Gainsbourg, Françoise Hardy, and Brigitte Fontaine), two originals, and a surprising spirit of curious experimentalism.

title: Numbers Lucent EP
label: Warp
description: Hot on the heels of October's concept album Just a Souvenir, Tom Jenkinson gets back to his raving roots with six meditations on drum'n'bass, breakcore, and acid house.

title: Noble Beast
label: Fat Possum
description: A detailed, patient grower in an era of overstuffed instant pleasures, the sound and tonal quality on Andrew Bird's latest album is often as important as the notes he plays or the words he sings.

title: Free Your Mind and Win a Pony
label: HappyParts
description: California's Golden Animals make retro Cali rock, embracing their inner Doors while skirting many of the pitfalls inherent in such an undertaking.

title: Get Young
label: Hardly Art
description: On their sophomore album, Boston's Pretty & Nice rework the playfully manic, barbed-wire sounds of Devo, XTC, and This Year's Model-era Elvis Costello.

title: The An Albatross Family Album
label: Eyeball
description: Genre-splicers An Albatross-- who pack more riffs, time changes, and esoteric rock references in one song than many bands jam into an entire album-- sweeten the pot with string arrangements and assorted uncharacteristic textures.

title: Grand
label: Fader
description: Over the past few years, Matt & Kim have taken Mates of State's spare, co-ed, drum'n'keys set-up and bled it of anything mannered or pretty; here, they slow down their spazzy synth-punk, and it suits them well.

title: Get Guilty
label: Matador
description: New Pornographers leader Carl Newman's second album follows the cues of his relatively quieter work-- 2004 solo album The Slow Wonder and the Pornographers' overlooked Challengers-- but still helps solidify him as a singular songwriter.

title: Stray Age
label: Sub Pop
description: With help from Petra Haden and Jesca Hoop, Kentucky-based singer-songwriter Daniel Martin Moore very quietly delivers his Sub Pop debut.

title: How Shadows Chase the Balance
label: Kranky
description: Latest and most accessible record to date from Boduf Songs, Kranky's rep in the more apocalyptic segment of the robust indie-folk scene that also includes Ben Chasny, David Thomas Broughton, and stylistic godfather David Tibet.

title: Black Diamond
label: Enchufada
